summary: Debate: NAP is flawed and unnecessary [SOHO Forum] David Friedman, Gene Epstein, Dennis Pratt [Pav]
description: For Whom: Lovers of the age-old libertarian debate between libertarian consequentialists and ethicists Description: Resolution: The right way to persuade people of libertarianism is by showing them that its outcomes are superior by their standards, without any resort to the flawed non-agression principle (NAP). Affirmative: David Friedman, An American economist, legal scholar, and anarcho-capitalist theorist, author of six non-fiction books, many articles and three novels. His most popular book is The Machinery of Freedom: Guide to a Radical Capitalism. Website . Image Negative: Gene Epstein, In 2018. Gene stepped down from a 25-year stint as Economics & Books Editor at Barron's Financial Weekly, where he wrote a widely-followed weekly column called "Economic Beat." Since then, Gene has been actively directing his debate society, www.thesohoforum.org, maintaining an active Twitter account @genesohoforum, writing articles and doing frequent interviews on many libertarian podcasts. . Website . Image Moderator: Dennis Pratt, Dennis is the Chef de Village of PorcFest XX 2023. This year's NH's Liberty Activist of the Year and the Keynote Speaker at NH Liberty Forum. He was the number 1 writer on libertarian topics on the competitive intellectual essay site Quora before moving to the Free State 4.5 years ago to become the consummate volunteer to create the Libertarian Homeland, starting liberty clubhouses including the famous SHELL, opening the Independence Inn, leading liberty bus tours, raising hell with the LPNH, and tweeting about liberarian ethics and the Free State. This is his fifth and last year volunteering to lead PorcFest. Catch his daily talks at Libety 101 on libertarianism.. Website When: Fri, 12:00P (120m) Where: Pav: Pavillion, Field Note: What underlies libertarianism? And what is the best way to explain it to newbies? Two greats go head to head on whether consequentialism or ethics are the proper way to position libertarianism.

summary: Easier to Convert: Homosexuality OR Libertarianism Jeremy Kauffman, Matt Kibbe, Gene Epstein [Pav]
description: For Whom: Have you been frustrated with converting people to libertarianism? Perhaps it's because it may harder than converting someone to homosexuality? Kauffman v. Kibbe square off on the recent question: Which is more innate: sexual or political orientation? Description: Resolution: "It would be easier to convert a heterosexual to homosexuality than to convert a non-libertarian to libertarianism" Affirmative: Jeremy Kauffman, Founder and CEO of Lbry and Odyssee, Jeremy is on the Board of the Free State Project. He ran for US Senate from NH, and is himself a free state mover with his wife and children. Jeremy has been failing to convert nonlibertarians to libertarianism for years, but while dating, proved to be surprisingly good at converting heterosexual women to homosexuality.. Website . Image Negative: Matt Kibbe, Matthew B. Kibbe is the President of Free the People and of Fight the Power Productions, and host of BlazeTV’s Kibbe on Liberty. He founded FreedomWorks, was senior advisor for a Rand Paul Presidential Super PAC Chief of Staff to U.S. Representative Dan Miller (R-FL), Budget Director for the U.S. Chamber of Commerce, and Senior Economist for the RNC. Among other books, he authored, the number 2 New York Times bestseller "Don’t Hurt People and Don’t Take Their Stuff". MSNBC’s Keith Olbermann called Kibbe “The second worst person in the world.” Graduate work in economics at George Mason, a B.A. in economics from Grove City College, Matt is DeadHead and a beer and whiskey connoisseur and apologist. He should be living in the Free State with his awesome wife Terry, and three objectivist cats.. Website . Image Moderator: Gene Epstein, In 2018. Gene stepped down from a 25-year stint as Economics & Books Editor at Barron's Financial Weekly, where he wrote a widely-followed weekly column called "Economic Beat." Since then, Gene has been actively directing his debate society, www.thesohoforum.org, maintaining an active Twitter account @genesohoforum, writing articles and doing frequent interviews on many libertarian podcasts. He is contemplating a second home in the Free State with wife and artists Hisako Kobayashi.. Website . Image When: Thu, 12:00P (120m) Where: Pav: Pavillion, Field

For Whom: Any attendees to the Porcupine Freedom Festival who really want to roll up their sleeves and help build freedom. This is a awesome way for newbies to meet people! Description: Volunteer to help your PorcFest volunteers unpack the truck, and set up for the week of festival. The Porcupine Freedom Festival is created by volunteers like you, and you can become one of them! . . . Come down to the Pavillion and help us unload, unpack, setup. . . . Meet all the movers and shakers of the most successful freedom movement who volunteer to dedicate their time to create actual freedom in an all-too-authoritarian world Organizer: Constance Spencer, Constance is our co-producer for PorcFest XX 2023. Having volunteered to manage Registration for the last five years, Constance is stepping up this year PorcFest Operations Direct, responsible for all the internal operations of PorcFest (Registration, Free Aid, Facilities, PorcRangers, Inventory, Info, Costs, Rogers relations, etc.) . . . When not volunteering to manage the complex operations of the largest freedom festival in the world, Constance is the lead of Independence Realty Group which is a real estate team at Coldwell Banker Realty. . . . She is an early mover for the Free State Project moving from Alaska in 2014 with her four children. In Alaska she was learning self-reliance by turning her small acreage home into a homestead through permaculture and raising chickens, ducks, turkeys, and pigs. She was also active in the home birth community and has always allowed her children education freedom which has included homeschooling, trade schools, and charter schools. . . . She has also been a real estate investor since her early twenties when she rented her single family home in Ohio and moved to Alaska. She and her partner currently have 13 rental units. Her passion is helping others navigate home ownership and real estate investing. She’s just as comfortable talking about peaceful parenting as she is discussing holding real estate in retirement accounts and sees both as paths to liberty. . . . Visit her hub at "Homeland" on the field.. Website . Image When: Mon, 1:00P (120m) Where: Pav: Pavillion, Field Note: ( We'll need your help packing up as well on Sunday!! )

Her passion is helping others navigate home ownership and real estate investing. She’s just as comfortable talking about peaceful parenting as she is discussing holding real estate in retirement accounts and sees both as paths to liberty. . . . Visit her hub at "Homeland" on the field.. Website . Image Chef de Village, PorcFest XX 2023: Dennis Pratt, This is Dennis' fifth and final year volunteering to coordinate PorcFest, and his third year as co-producer/"Chef de Village". He is in charge of positioning, events, hubs, speakers, sponsors, marketing, and revenues. . . . Dennis reimagined PorcFest in 2020 to align more with our FSP goals to attract liberty lovers to the Free State, and to connect and activate those liberty lovers to build greater liberty. . . . Dennis has found refuge in the Free State over the last four and a half years, having suffered decades in authoritarian states. Don't let his galootish looks fool you! Rolling up his sleeves, he has become one of the Free State's most entrepreneurial volunteers, starting up liberty clubhouses (including the famous SHELL), liberty bus tours, liberty events. a liberty inn. In a myriad other ways, he connects liberty lovers together and inspires them to build. He's an ethicist, well known amongst really nerdy circles. You can hear him talk in the Liberty 101 hub, when he's not driving around, with his wife Carol and his pup Ron Paw, making sure everything's copacetic. . . . He was this year's NH Liberty Activist of the Year, and the Keynote Speaker for NH Liberty Forum. He's a hugger, so warn him off if he gets too close!. Website . Image When: Sun, 9:00A (120m) Where: Pav: Pavillion, Field Note: Volunteers meet every day at 9AM

For Whom: Those would enjoy the piss and vinegar of a great anti-authoritarian rant, and those who can deliver it!
Description: Bring YOUR best 3-minute rant to be judged by an esteemed panel of celebertarian judges, moderated by Queen Quill herself, Carla Gericke (usually in a compromised condition.)
. . . Now in its 11th year, don't miss the ultimate crowd favorite SoapBox Idol! Prepare your best 3-minute rant on the topic of your choice. Whatever really bugs you, here is your chance to bitch to -- and convince -- a receptive audience.
. . . The top Idolers will do their best to impress their passion and insight on the audience and a panel of esteemed judges. Your applause selects the final winner. 
Queen Quill: Carla Gericke, The Queen herself presides over the PorcFest favorite event that she invented and has presided over for more than a decade. Carla is a superb ranter herself - on the House floor, at traffic stops, and in courtrooms - she is looking for new raw talent, as well as inspiring older talent to new heights
When: Sat, 6:00P (150m)
Where: Pav: Pavillion, Field
Note: This event is not suitable for sensitive ears.
Loud encouragement from the audience is appreciated.
You MUST audition (10A at the Queen Quill tent each day) to secure a coveted spot atop the soapbox on Saturday.

summary: Panel: NBC Producers on Free State Project Shira Stoll, Dan Ferrigan, Erica Jorgensen, Dennis Pratt [Pav]
description: For Whom: People interested in the Free State Project, in Main Stream Media press coverage of libertarianism, and in long-form documentaries of controversial subjects. Description: Hear the expectations and the experiences of the Producers who embedded eight months for a documentary of the Free State Project, and ask questions. . . . "Life, Liberty, and the Pursuit of New Hampshire follows a libertarian political migration known as the Free State Project. Twenty years ago, one man penned a manifesto encouraging 20,000 libertarians to sign a pledge and move to the Granite State for more freedom. Now “The Free State Project” is shaking up politics and communities in New Hampshire and growing in strength and numbers." Co-Director, Producer, Cinematographer: Shira Stoll, Shira Stoll is the Co-Director + Producer of Life, Liberty and the Pursuit of New Hampshire. She is a regional Emmy and Murrow award winning video producer and journalist on the Special Projects + Streaming unit at NBC10 Boston working on long form narratives and investigative stories. . . . Shira was awarded a 2022 Regional Edward R. Murrow Award for her role on the project “Where I’m Really From,” a 2022 New England Emmy for The Chinatown Massacre documentary and a 2019 New York Emmy for Where Life Leads You: Stories of Staten Island’s Holocaust survivors.. Website . Image Co-Director, Producer, Cinematographer: Dan Ferrigan, Award-winning photojournalist and filmmaker Dan Ferrigan is the Co-Director + Producer of Life, Liberty and the Pursuit of New Hampshire. . . . Dan has worked around the world in nonfiction storytelling. Traveling to India, Dan worked on India: A New Life, commissioned by PBS-Frontline World. In 2008, India: A New Life received three Telly awards. Dan worked with New England Cable News (NECN) in Norway to shoot the 2010 AP award-winning documentary, Unequal Justice? The Joseph Donovan Story. Dan was the cinematographer on the Emmy-nominated documentary THE WAY WE GET BY released theatrically in July 2009, playing in over 60 cities nationwide. The film had its world premiere at the South By Southwest Film Festival (SXSW) in March 2009 and won the Special Jury Award. THE WAY WE GET BY has won 18 festival awards to date. Dan grew up in Winslow, Maine, and currently resides in Needham, Massachusetts.. Website Executive Producer: Erica Jorgensen, Erica Jorgensen is the Executive Producer Special Projects + Streaming at NBC10 Boston I Telemundo Boston I NECN at NBCUniversal Media, LLC. Moderator: Dennis Pratt, Dennis is the Chef de Village of PorcFest XX 2023, this year's NH's Liberty Activist of the Year, and the Keynote Speaker at NH Liberty Forum. He was the number 1 writer on libertarian topics on the competitive intellectual essay site Quora before moving to the Free State 4.5 years ago to become the consummate volunteer to create the Libertarian Homeland, starting liberty clubhouses including the famous SHELL, opening the Independence Inn, leading liberty bus tours, raising hell with the LPNH, and tweeting about liberarian ethics and the Free State. This is his fifth and last year volunteering to lead PorcFest. Catch his daily talks on libertarianism at Libety 101.. Website . Image When: Fri, 7:00P (120m) Where: Pav: Pavillion, Field Note: A 45 minute subset (three of 11 episodes) of the docuseries will be played at 6P on Friday to whet your appetite, watch together, and remind you before the panel discussion. . . . The full docuseries will be played on Wed night in the Liberty 101 at 6P. . . . And you may pre-view the series before you come to PorcFest by following the above link to NBC Boston for Free State Project docuseries. More Info

summary: Maj Toure - Black Guns Matter Maj Touré [Pav]
description: For Whom: Second amendment advocates and dissenters. Description: Maj Toure, a native of North Philadelphia, founded the educational nonprofit organization Black Guns Matter in 2016. The organization advocates for the right to keep and bear arms and promotes responsible ownership of firearms within African-American and urban communities. Speaker: Maj Touré, Maj Toure, a native of North Philadelphia, founded the educational nonprofit organization Black Guns Matter in 2016. The organization advocates for the right to keep and bear arms and promotes responsible ownership of firearms within African-American and urban communities. He has released three rap/hip hop recordings: Solutionary Vol. 1 (2005), Solutionary Vol. 2 (2014), and Solutionary Vol. 3 (2016). Toure was a candidate for an at-large seat in the Philadelphia City Council in the city's 2019 election. He ran as a Libertarian. In addition to his support for Second Amendment rights, his stated political priorities included: criminal justice reform; ending the practice of solitary confinement; legalization of cannabis; improved education in Philadelphia; and conflict resolution training for disconnected youths. Website . Image When: Thu, 4:00P _(60m) Where: Pav: Pavillion, Field Note: Maj Toure is rumored to be a potential VP candidate on the 2024 Libertarian ticket. More Info

summary: Anatomy of the Coup D'Etat Jeffrey Tucker [Pav]
description: For Whom: TBD Description: The real history of our times is shrouded in secrecy but we know enough to piece it together. There was an overthrown of civilian government in this country and its replacement by a military-baed biomedical security state. The crisis is urgent and the solution must begin with knowledge. Speaker: Jeffrey Tucker, Founder and President of the Brownstone Institute, Jeffrey is the author of many thousands of articles in the scholarly and popular press and ten books in 5 languages, most recently Liberty or Lockdown. He is also the editor of The Best of Mises. He speaks widely on topics of economics, technology, social philosophy, and culture. . Website . Image When: Sat, 4:00P (120m) Where: Pav: Pavillion, Field More Info

For Whom: Libertarian Party members, potential movers, lover of "mean tweets" and haters of mass murder. Description: Reed's beliefs and friendships were put to the test when he made a post mocking Meghan McCain on the anniversary of her father’s death and drew condemnation from all corners of the political spectrum, including his own. Join Reed as he reflects about his re-integration into the Free State, a Libertarian Homeland that has advanced far further than he remembered it when he left. Speaker: Reed Coverdale, Reed Coverdale is a blue collar worker, trucker, power lineman, podcaster, and "re-mover" to the Free State, who spent a good portion of 2022 helping liberty win in NH by contributing to Jeremy Kauffman’s Senate run, and to social media for the Libertarian Party of NH. When: Thu, 3:00P _(60m) Where: Pav: Pavillion, Field More Info

summary: The Croydon Budget Battle Ian Underwood, Jody Underwood [Pav]
description: For Whom: Interested in school reform, school choice, battles over property taxes and monied interests, breaking the indoctrination camps. Description: In 2022, the town of Croydon NH voted at its annual school district meeting to replace the usual ransom demanded by the administration with a budget offered by the taxpayers. The point of this change was to force the serious consideration of a number of fundamental questions about education that never get considered under the ransom model of funding. Unfortunately, the conversation was quickly derailed into a referendum about Free Staters. We'll discuss what actually happened in Croydon (in contrast to what the media reported), and what we should learn from it. We'll continue the conversation at Firesteel at 3pm to brainstorm how we can win the war even though we lost the battle. Speaker: Ian Underwood, Ian Underwood has been a planetary scientist and artificial intelligence researcher for NASA, the director of the renowned Ask Dr. Math service, co-founder of Bardo Farm and Shaolin Rifleworks, and a popular speaker at liberty-related events. He is the author of a series of Bare Minimum Books, which expose the simplicity underlying complex issues like law, education, and gun rights. He lives in Croydon, New Hampshire.. Website . Image Speaker: Jody Underwood, Jody Underwood served on the Croydon School Board from 2010-2023. She shepherded a bill through the NH legislature to clarify the law to allow private schools to be included in town tuitioning agreements. She is a founding board member of the School District Governance Association of NH (sdganh.org), whose mission is to help school board members discover their powers so they don’t get overrun by administrators. . . . Jody has written research papers about how New Hampshire uses tax dollars for private schools and about how town tuitioning works in New Hampshire. She has delivered presentations about town tuitioning and school choice around the state. . . In her day job, from which she has recently retired, she has conducted research and development of technology to support learning and assessment in the classroom since 1988. . . She and her husband moved to New Hampshire in 2007, where they live on a large off-the-grid property in Croydon.. Image When: Wed, 2:00P _(60m) Where: Pav: Pavillion, Field More Info

Wednesday 3PM-4PM PAV Speaker: Elizabeth Duffy. Image When: Wed, 3:00P _(60m) Where: Pav: Pavillion, Field Note: Language may not be suitable for young audiences. More Info

summary: FSP: The Good, The Fab and the Fugly Carla Gericke [Pav]
description: For Whom: Free Staters, Wanna-be-Free Staters, and people who wish they could be Free Staters. Description: Twenty years have come and gone, and we're only getting started! Where are we now and where are we going? Join Carla as she reflects on the end of the beginning, and what her vision is for the next 20 years in the Free State. Big goals require big dreams. Come discover how we can make New Hampshire our libertarian homeland. Live free and thrive! Speaker: Carla Gericke, Carla is an early mover and OG, taking executive and volunteer roles within the FSP since 2008, as well as leading efforts to make New Hampshire more free by serving on boards and running for office. Carla is affectionately known as ‘Queen Quill’, is the Chair of the Free State Project, lead producer of numerous PorcFests, and constant volunteer. She spearheads innumerable liberty efforts in the Free State, including issues relating to 1st, 2nd, 4th and 10th Amendment issues, government accountability/transparency, and how to Live Free and Thrive!. Website When: Thu, 5:00P _(60m) Where: Pav: Pavillion, Field More Info

For Whom: People who want to make Liberty in Our Lifetime happen Description: October 1, 2003 was the date we announced New Hampshire’s selection as the Free State. Contrary to expectations, liberty lovers started moving right away. Thousands have now moved and gotten active. What impact have we had? What impact will we have over the next 20 years? Speaker: Jason Sorens, The Free State Project was founded in 2001 by Jason Sorens, then a Ph.D. student at Yale University. Jason was studying independence movements in other countries and thinking about how liberty-minded folk could have an impact as a small minority in the world and the U.S. Jason published an article in The Libertarian Enterprise highlighting the failure of libertarians to elect any candidate to federal office and outlining his ideas for a migration movement that continues an American tradition of political migration, which includes groups such as Mormon settlers in Utah, Amish religious communities, and the "Jamestown Seventy", an earlier effort to influence the politics of a particular state through deliberate migration. Jason's essay eventually became the founding document of the Free State Project. In it, Jason proposed a mass migration, a voluntary resettlement of 20,000 libertarians, anarchists, anarcho-capitalists, pacifists, even freedom-minded Democrats and Republicans, to a single, relatively liberty-friendly state, where they could establish a beachhead of personal and economic freedom. Today, Jason is Senior Research Faculty at AIER and lives with his family in Amherst, New Hampshire. When: Fri, 11:00A _(60m) Where: Pav: Pavillion, Field More Info

summary: Doing What Must Be Done Jeremy Kauffman [Pav]
description: For Whom: People curious about the history and strategy of the Free State movement, Free State skeptics, Free State newbies, people who like bad jokes Description: Libertarians are a dominated political minority. They are isolated, surrounded, and sometimes so depressed they think there is no hope. In this talk, we'll look at why that is, why the Free State movement is a solution to these fundamental problems, and where the movement goes from here. Speaker: Jeremy Kauffman, Founder of LBRY and Odysee, Jeremy is on the Board of the Free State Project. He ran for US Senate from NH, and is himself a Free State mover with his wife and 4 children.. Website When: Sat, 11:00A _(60m) Where: Pav: Pavillion, Field More Info

summary: Washington Want's War With China Connor Freeman [Pav]
description: For Whom: Anyone who thinks "Beijing Biden" is soft on China. Description: The ruling class in Washington is planning on using America’s sons and daughters as cannon fodder to wage their long-awaited war against China. President Joe Biden along with the other de facto employees of the military industrial complex, including in Congress, have not made their plans a secret. Contrarily, they are quite happy to brag about basically any escalation they can get. Speaker: Connor Freeman, Connor Freeman is the assistant editor and a writer at the Libertarian Institute, primarily covering foreign policy. He is a co-host on Conflicts of Interest. His writing has been featured in media outlets such as Antiwar.com and Counterpunch, as well as the Ron Paul Institute for Peace and Prosperity. He has also appeared on Liberty Weekly, Around the Empire, and Parallax Views. You can follow him on Twitter @FreemansMind96. Website . Image When: Tue, 4:00P _(60m) Where: Pav: Pavillion, Field More Info

summary: What You Need to Know About Waco Scott Horton [Pav]
description: For Whom: Anyone interested in finding out all the evidence proving how evil the FBI and ATF are. Description: In 1993 the US Federal government murdered 86 men, women and children in a show of force. Since then the FBI and ATF have tried to cover their tracks by pinning the deaths on "religious extremism" and David Koresh. In this talk Scott Horton will tell you the truth about that day. Speaker: Scott Horton, Scott Horton is director of the Libertarian Institute, editorial director of Antiwar.com, host of Antiwar Radio on Pacifica, 90.7 FM KPFK in Los Angeles, California and podcasts the Scott Horton Show from ScottHorton.org. He's the author of the 2021 book Enough Already: Time to End the War on Terrorism, the 2017 book, Fool's Errand:Time to End the War in Afghanistan, editor of the 2019 book The Great Ron Paul: The Scott Horton Show Interviews 2004–2019 and the 2022 book Hotter Than The Sun: Time to Abolish Nuclear Weapons. Speaker: Naomi Brockwell, Naomi Brockwell is a tech journalist, and creator of "NBTV.media". NBTV teaches people how to reclaim control of their lives in the digital age. The channel gives people the tools they need to take back their data, money, and free online expression. From 2013 - 2015 she worked as a policy associate at the New York Bitcoin Center. From 2015 - 2021 she has worked as a producer for 19-times Emmy-Award-Winning Journalist John Stossel. From 2021 to 2022 she hosted the CoinDesk series “Break it Down”, and the CoinDesk daily show “The Hash”. Naomi was a producer for the 2015 feature documentary Bitcoin: The End of Money as We Know It (Best International Documentary, Anthem Film Festival; Winner of Special Jury Prize, Amsterdam Film Festival), and producer of the 2018 award-winning documentary about the housing crash The Bubble. Naomi is the co-founder of “The Soho Forum”, a NY debate series. description: For Whom: Think DC reformable? Interested in the 2023 Presidential contest? Curious about Vivek? Want to unseat the deep State Description: < E.g., Does the Deep State? Is it reformable? Matt Kibbe will interview Vivek Ramaswamy, [R] candidate for President about his intention to dismantle the Deep State. The Free State Project attracts libertarians who wish to separate from the DC overlords because many of us don't believe DC is ever able to be libertated. Vivek disagrees; he promises to remove 75% of the deep state. Can anyone do this? Matt Kibbe will conduct a special Free The People broadcast from the Big Stage of PorcFest to explore the existenc, strength, and reformability of the Deep State. He will also ask this candidate about this other libertarian and not-so-libertarian proposals. Your questions can probe deeper. Interviewee: Vivek Ramaswamy, Vivek Ramaswamy is the first millennial to run for the Republican nomination for president. He is an American business leader and the author of books including Woke, Inc.: Inside Corporate America’s Social Justice Scam and Capitalist Punishment: How Wall Street is Using Your Money to Create a Country You Didn't Vote For. ‍ The media has called him the "intellectual godfathers of the anti-woke movement." Vivek helped identify and popularize discussion of wokeism in mainstream conservative thought. Born and raised in Cincinnati, Ohio, Vivek was valedictorian of his high school, went on to graduate summa cum laude in Biology from Harvard and received his J.D. from Yale Law School, while working at a hedge fund. He later started a biotech company, Roivant Sciences, where he oversaw the development of five drugs that went on to become FDA-approved. In 2022, he founded Strive, an Ohio-based asset management firm that directly competes with asset managers like BlackRock, State Street, Vanguard and others, use the money of everyday citizens to advance environmental and social agendas that many citizens and capital owners disagree with. Vivek is married to Apoorva, a throat surgeon and Assistant Professor at the Ohio State University Wexner Medical Center. They live in Columbus, Ohio where they are raising their two sons. . Website Interviewer: Matt Kibbe, When: Sat, 10:00A _(60m) Where: Pav: Pavillion, Field More Info

Larry’s unique style, personal background, and professional experience combine to inspire, inform, and persuade his listeners, readers, and viewers to embrace the timeless American principles of personal responsibility and public accountability. In his words: “The question is not which party has my back, but which party can get government off our backs.” Larry was born and raised in South Central Los Angeles, and his family’s story represents every bit of the American Dream. His father was born in Athens, Georgia, served in the U.S. Marine Corps during World War II, and moved to California to open his own restaurant—Elder’s Snack Bar. Larry’s mother, originally from Huntsville, Alabama, was a clerical worker and raised three boys as a stay-at-home mom. Speaker: Reinita Susman, Reinita Susman in a documentarian and recent mover to New Hampshire. She produced a documentary in 2021 about lockdowns in southern CA. Her documentary about the Free State is meant as the antidote to the dark and sad story of her previous documentary. . For Whom: Those who are curious at the nuts and bolts of HOW the Free State has become more and more free while the Authoritarian-49 have slipped more and more into tyranny. Those who are ready to help make New Hampshire even more free. Description: The New Hampshire Liberty Alliance is an organization run by volunteers like you, that review almost every bill going through the New Hampshire State House, for its impact on liberty, advises legislators whether bills are pro- or anti- human freedom, and rates NH legislators to let voters know which are trying to free them versus enslave them. If the price of Liberty is eternal vigilance, then NHLA intends to be eternally vigilant! Speaker: Melissa Creem Chair NHLA, Chair of NHLA When: Sat, 11:00A _(60m) Where: 101: Liberty 101, Office More Info

summary: Why Porcupines Run as Republicans Ian Underwood [101]
description: For Whom: Liberty folks who want to get involved in the political system, especially in NH. Description: Looking to make changes in the law, but scared of the "Republican" label that many Porcupine legislators use? . . . Learn why even the hardest core libertarians in NH do not -- and should not -- shy away from running as "Republicans". Speaker: Ian Underwood, Ian Underwood has been a planetary scientist and artificial intelligence researcher for NASA, the director of the renowned Ask Dr. Math service, co-founder of Bardo Farm and Shaolin Rifleworks, and a popular speaker at liberty-related events. He is the author of a series of Bare Minimum Books, which expose the simplicity underlying complex issues like law, education, and gun rights. He lives in Croydon, New Hampshire.. Website When: Wed, 11:00A _(60m) Where: 101: Liberty 101, Office

summary: A Free Marketeer's Guide to Economic Data Gene Epstein [101]
description: For Whom: Fans of free market economics; liberty lovers & investors who care about the state of the economy & concerns that workers are getting shafted.. Description: Though use of official data, I puncture various myths about the state of the economy (like what caused the price inflation). Speaker: Gene Epstein, In 2018. Gene stepped down from a 25-year stint as Economics & Books Editor at Barron's Financial Weekly, where he wrote a widely-followed weekly column called "Economic Beat." Since then, Gene has been actively directing his debate society, www.thesohoforum.org, maintaining an active Twitter account @genesohoforum, writing articles and doing frequent interviews on many libertarian podcasts. . Image When: Sat, 10:00A _(60m) Where: 101: Liberty 101, Office

summary: Free State Food Network: Securing Our Own Food Stephen Nass [101]
description: For Whom: People interested in eating food, even when the masses are starving Description: We're pushing back on government interference in New Hampshire, but in the food industry we have a long way to go. We all saw how in 2020 the state shut down businesses and tasked them with arbitrary rules and fines. For restaurants and food producers this level of bureaucracy is nothing new. Learn how we can team up to help free our farmers, chefs and food professionals in our Free State quest for liberty. Speaker: Stephen Nass, Restaurant owner, chef, and one of the founders behind the Shell community center.. Website . Image When: Wed, 2:00P _(60m) Where: 101: Liberty 101, Office More Info

summary: The SHELL: A Liberty Community Center Stephen, Scott [101]
description: For Whom: People who feel that liberty is lonely, because in the Free State, it ain't. Description: The SHELL opened right as CoVid lockdown happened -- two weeks later 70 Free Staters were attending a Robbie The Fire comedy night. It has become the Free State's premiere liberty clubhouse, with more events than all the other clubhouses combined. . . . We'll describe The SHELL, its history, its importance to the Free State, and how it, and other Free State liberty clubhouses like it, are a key reason why you should be moving here. : Stephen : Scott, When: Thu, 12:00P _(60m) Where: 101: Liberty 101, Office More Info

summary: Defend the Guard: Uphold the Constitution Derek Proux [101]
description:
For Whom: Military. Anti-War. Free Staters. People concerned with overbearing Federal Government being able to bully states. How to nullify Fed gov.

Description: What can a Free State do to impede an overbearing Federal Government? Nullification.
. . . Defend the Guard is the just one example of the type of nullification that we would execute to stop government over-reach -- in this case, the warfare state.
. . . Defend the Guard says that the state will not contribute its National Guard to undeclared overseas. Learn the history, current status, and prospects of this historic nullification.
Speaker: Derek Proux
When: Fri, 3:00P _(60m)
Where: 101: Liberty 101, Office

summary: A Not-So-Brief History of the Free State Carla Gericke [101]
description: For Whom: People new to the Free State, or who don't know how we got here. Description: Dirty laundry, you say? Who has better behind-the-scenes scoops than Queen Quill herself? Between major milestones and major dramas, the story of the Free State Project is a story of human action, and how a group of tireless volunteers took a quaint idea and turned it into the world's most historic movement for freedom in the world today. Speaker: Carla Gericke, Carla is an early mover and OG, taking executive and volunteer roles within the FSP since 2008, as well as leading efforts to make New Hampshire more free by serving on boards and running for office. Carla is affectionately known as ‘Queen Quill’, is the Chair of the Free State Project, lead producer of numerous PorcFests, and constant volunteer. She spearheads innumerable liberty efforts in the Free State, including issues relating to 1st, 2nd, 4th and 10th Amendment issues, government accountability/transparency, and how to Live Free and Thrive!. Website When: Tue, 2:00P _(60m) Where: 101: Liberty 101, Office More Info

description:
For Whom: People interested in the housing market, anyone interested in local government, anyone who wants to help NH rise in the freedom rankings

Speaker: Jason Sorens

Where: 101: Liberty 101, Office

description: For Whom: If you even mildly dislike taxes. If you love taxes and believe "It's the price we voluntarily pay for society." Speaker: Dan Taxation Is Theft Behrman. Website . Image When: Thu, 3:00P _(60m) Where: 101: Liberty 101, Office More Info

summary: 10 Progressive Lies About Economics Keith Knight [101]
description: For Whom: Anyone interested in combatting the statist claims of academics. Description: Progressive ideas are dominant in academia, the press, Hollywood, human resource departments, and in the everyday assumptions of voters. Their confidence in promoting these ideas comes from their complete ignorance regarding the study of the use of scarce resources which have alternative uses. I will go through 10 examples of why the deadly religion of Progressivism should be relentlessly mocked. Speaker: Keith Knight, My primary motive for starting my podcast was to give people access to a free alternative to college education regarding history, economics, politics, and philosophy. . For Whom: People who would like to understand economics. Also people who think they do understand economics but cannot see why anyone would want to. Description: Economics is a way of understanding human behavior relevant not only to issues such as inflation and unemployment but also war, marriage, politics and much else. It is of particular interest to libertarians because it provides the tools to understand how large numbers of individuals can coordinate their activities with nobody at the top telling everyone else what to do. Speaker: David Friedman, An American economist, legal scholar, and anarcho-capitalist theorist, author of six non-fiction books, many articles and three novels. His most popular book is The Machinery of Freedom: Guide to a Radical Capitalism. Website When: Sat, 12:00P _(60m) Where: 101: Liberty 101, Office More Info

summary: Escaping the Most Dangerous Superstition Larken Rose [101]
description: For Whom: This talk is especially for all those people who are not yet familiar with my work, or what my main "theme" is in almost everything I do. Description: Many millions of people desperately want to make the world a better place, while unaware of the fact that they themselves are unwitting "carriers" and "spreaders" of the primary obstacle to peace, prosperity, and human progress. Good intentions are not enough, among people whose thinking is still warped and twisted by an anti-human superstition. And, unfortunately, that describes the majority of the world's population. Speaker: Larken Rose. Website When: Thu, 1:00P _(60m) Where: 101: Liberty 101, Office

description:
For Whom: People interested in creating media, writers, videographers, film lovers
Description: Media has increasingly become dominated by a standard set of rules put forth by a controlling class of corporate activists who are immeshed with government forces. Those who venture to create media that goes against these prescribed narratives are met with constant roadblocks and threats to their livelihoods. Meet a few of those people and get a perspective of the inside of an industry gate-kept by corrupt institutions.
Moderator: Reinita Susman, Reinita Susman in a documentarian and recent mover to New Hampshire. She produced a documentary in 2021 about lockdowns in southern CA. Her documentary about the Free State is meant as the antidote to the dark and sad story of her previous documentary. 
Panelist: Andrew Treglia, 
Panelist: Jessica Solce,

For Whom: Newer libertarians still getting acquainted with the ideas and the community. Description: A lot of libertarians have their Ron Paul moment. It's a time they fondly remember where Ron Paul had a monumental impact on their life that ultimately led them down the libertarian path. But what about those who haven't had a such a moment? Join DL as he recounts his pivotal moment that started his libertarian journey. He'll also provide pro-tips for "surviving" your libertarian journey as a newer libertarian. And if you're a seasoned libertarian, come and listen for a refresher of what it's like to be new. Speaker: DL, is an engaging speaker who seeks to remind people what it's like to be new and discuss libertarianism in the most simple way. He'll discuss his journey and observations for the benefit of new libertarians, and even give the seasoned libertarian some things to think about. When: Thu, 4:00P _(60m) Where: 101: Liberty 101, Office More Info

summary: Death Athletic doc featuring Cody Wilson Jessica Solce [101]
description: For Whom: Documentary lovers who are attracted to tools that displace government control, in-depth stories covering the divisive techno-political world of 3D guns & modes of crypto-anarchy, and unknown stories. 1A, 2A, Ghost Guns, 3D Guns, Cody Wilson, Defense Distributed, DEFCAD, Deterrence Dispensed, Bear Arms & Bitcoin Description: Special Advanced Screening of feature documentary DEATH ATHLETIC, A Dissident Architecture followed by Q&A with the film's director. Join this special screening of Jessica Solce’s second feature documentary, an eight year profile of Cody Wilson, Defense Distributed and the 3D gun community. Director Jessica Solce will be in attendance for the film’s Q&A. Director: Jessica Solce, Death Athletic is Jessica Solce second feature documentary. summary: A Free State Project in your state or country? Mark Vandermaas, Founder, NBFP (nbfree.ca), Derek Proux, Dennis Pratt [101]
description: For Whom: Canadians. Foreigners from other countries who cannot immigrate. Americans from other states who would rather not migrate to New Hampshire. Prospects for liberty in more than one location. Description: Wouldn't you love to create a Free State Project in your state? In your country? Right next door. Wouldn't have to move. . . . Our Canadian friends have languished in Canada without the ability to legally escape to New Hampshire, so they have done just that. The founder of the New Brunswick FreeProvince Project...modelled on our own movement...will talk about his reasons and plans for their liberty project, as well as their gratitude for help from Free Staters. The Chef will talk about the prospects of other "Free State Project" efforts. Panelist: Mark Vandermaas, Founder, NBFP (nbfree.ca), Mark Vandermaas is a former Canadian soldier and United Nations peacekeeper who founded the New Brunswick FreeProvince Project (nbfree.ca) in 2021 after witnessing the human rights abuses associated with Covid. The mission and strategy of the NBFP was inspired by the NHFSP: liberate Canadians from socialist oppression by concentrating freedom-lovers in a sparsely-populated (800K) province. In 2023, the NBFP became the first and only Canadian freedom project to be listed in the Free Cities Foundation's directory of 'Free Communities' (free-communities.org). Prior to Covid, Mark had many years of experience as a rule of law activist defending Canada's Charter of Rights against abuses by police, government, media, leftist radicals and violent Native militants during a fraudulent land claim dispute in Caledonia, Ontario. He was part of a team whose work led to a 9-0 victory at the Supreme Court of Canada that defined the limits of police/government infringement of the constitution during an 'emergency.' Mark's work is cited in two books about the Caledonia crisis: the bestseller, 'Helpless: Caledonia's Nightmare of Fear And Anarchy, And How The Law Failed All Of Us,' and the near-best-seller, 'Victory In The No-Go Zone: Winning The Fight Against Two-Tier Policing.' In September 2021, Mark released a prescient report outlining in detail the concerns about the mRNA 'vaccines' and the devastating consequences to society of using coercion to force them on citizens: 'Vaccine Hesitancy And The Risks Of Medical Segregation Discrimination Policies.' It can be downloaded at nbfree.ca/number downloads. . Website . Image Moderator: Derek Proux, Panelist: Dennis Pratt, Designer of current series of PorcFests, Chef de Village of last three PorcFests, founder of SHELL, Swell, Independence Inn, Free State Tours, 42 years arguing for liberty, 4.5 years in New Hampshire and major shill for focusing our energies on creating one Libertarian Homeland. Northwestern, MIT, entrepreneurship, married 43 years.. Website . Image When: Thu, 2:00P _(60m) Where: 101: Liberty 101, Office Note: The NH Free State Project is leading the world in liberty. Come and hear how our New Brunswick neighbours have taken our success to heart to begin the process of liberating fellow Canadians from tyranny. More Info

summary: How Government Schools Transition Your Child Gabrielle Clark, Karlyn Borysenko [101]
description: For Whom: Anyone with kids in government schools needs to come to this event. Description: The government schools tried to socially transition Gabrielle Clark's daughter to believe she was a boy. In this session, Gabs will discuss her journey with the schools and explain how she got her daughter back. Panelist: Gabrielle Clark Moderator: Karlyn Borysenko, When: Wed, 5:00P _(60m) Where: 101: Liberty 101, Office More Info

summary: Proof: Guns Make You Safer and Wealthier James Ostrowski [101]
description:
For Whom: If you argue about gun control, know the facts
Description: Anti-self defense proponents assert that gun control is "civilized". Is it? Or does it make you less safe and less wealthy.  Jim has developed an index to examine the impact of gun control across countries and the results are startling. This should end the debate on gun control (but it won't).
Speaker: James Ostrowski
When: Tue, 5:00P _(60m)
Where: 101: Liberty 101, Office

summary: Your Consent Matters: Intro to Voluntaryism Jack Lloyd [101]
description: For Whom: This event is a must for those new to libertarian thinking and a great challenge for those who struggle with the dilemma of thinking outside the state. Description: Does consent REALLY matter? Join Jack Lloyd as he goes over the fundamentals of the consent-based ethical philosophy known as "Voluntaryism" from his book, The Definitive Guide to Libertarian Voluntaryism. Speaker: Jack Lloyd, Jack Lloyd is a multimedia content producer for liberty. His work spans both fiction and nonfiction with educational videos, music, music videos, skits, a comic book series, and his nonfiction books, The Definitive Guide to Libertarian Voluntaryism and A Vision for a Libertarian Future. His ongoing production projects include Voluntaryist – The Comic Series, The Pholosopher, The Honest Teacher, and Red Flag Reality. He is well-known for creating the viral “Taxation is Theft” meme trend when he was a member of Anarchyball and for continuing that promotion year after year with hard-hitting content. Before he became a producer full time, he worked as a criminal defense lawyer, government school teacher, and tutoring company owner. He brings his insights from those roles to help people understand the importance of human freedom.. Website . Image When: Wed, 1:00P _(60m) Where: 101: Liberty 101, Office Note: A question and answer will follow for those who want to get more guidance.

For Whom: The curious, those who know all empires end eventually, and people who want to learn about other secession groups to help their own state movements Description: A review of secession movements in these united states today, mention of a few international movements, followed by a Q&A. NHExit, Texit, FLexit, Calexit, Greater Idaho, Capexit, and more! number NationalDivorce Speaker: Keith Bessette, Keith hosts the weekly Rebel Civics Show on Unsafe Space, where he has extensively covered various secession activities and books. He has interviewed people from secession movements in the US and abroad. Keith presented the well-received "Secession 101" talk at last year's PorcFest in the Liberty 101 classroom, is admin of the "FLexit" Facebook group, and writes for UncoverDC, Unsafe Space, and Liberty Block.. Website When: Fri, 1:00P _(60m) Where: 101: Liberty 101, Office Note: The peaceful way to handle irreconcilable differences is to walk away and let others live how they choose. All other choices require forcing one set of preferences on other people. More Info

summary: Convention of States: Pros & Cons Keith Bessette [101]
description: For Whom: People who still believe Washington DC can be fixed and want to find out more about what an Article V Convention might do, what it is unlikely to do, and what it cannot do. Description: The US Constitution has a solution to fix omissions, clarify existing text, and add additional restrictions on the Federal government -- call a "Convention of States" under Article V, where the States would propose amendments to improve the Constitution. What are the pros and cons, and is this solution as big as the problem? The talk will be followed by a Q&A period. Speaker: Keith Bessette, Keith worked for Convention of States Project for two years, wrote articles for the COS website, hosted the Liberty Solutions podcast covering current events and how an Article V Convention could help fix today's problems, and ran booths at public events for COS outreach and petition signing. Keith twice had the second highest monthly COS petition signing count in the 50 states through his activism. He has now given up working toward an Article V convention and has a few thoughts on the strategy. Professionally, Keith is an electrical and systems engineer with 30 years experience designing communications systems for military aircraft, ships, and submarines. Keith currently hosts the Rebel Civics show on Unsafe Space, writes for UncoverDC and Liberty Block, and wonders how much longer these united states can remain politically tied together in the current form.. Website . Image When: Wed, 12:00P _(60m) Where: 101: Liberty 101, Office Note: The Constitution was well done, but it could provide better limits on the federal government by clarifying existing text and adding additional restrictions on the feds. Would that matter? More Info

Dan hosts The System is Down, which focuses on the fun "uncomfortable" topics, like conspiracies, politics, religion, and current events in the least reverent ways possible. Dan is also single, moderately humorous, and his DM's are open... js... ...No freaks and no normies... Find some balance, yo. The end. That's my bio. . Website When: Wed, 4:00P _(60m) Where: 101: Liberty 101, Office Note: Let's get weird. More Info

summary: Die Free: Free State Assisted Suicide Conner Drigotas [101]
description: For Whom: Concerned about your own end of life - that you won't be able to control when and how you die, and how much pain and expense and time it takes? Or concerned for other loved ones, whom you wouldn't be able to help without facing prison. Description: Someday, you are going to die. Under current law, government officials claim power to prevent you from accessing compassionate care, limiting your right to your own body. Libertarianism rests on self-ownership. Logically your most intimate decision - when to end your body's existence - should be yours alone to make. The state abrogates self-ownership and in some cases, condemns people to painful, prolonged draining death when humane alternatives exist. Each person will face this decision, if not for your own body, for that of a loved one. Come discuss current law, proposed liberty friendly solutions, and join those seeking to expand compassionate care in New Hampshire. Speaker: Conner Drigotas, Conner Drigotas is a volunteer with the Living Dying project and the managing editor of an investigative journalism newsroom. You can reach him at drigotas@duck.com When: Fri, 4:00P _(60m) Where: 101: Liberty 101, Office Note: This is an invitation to discuss an emerging group within the Free State taking on a topic that the liberty community has not until this point taken on. The thinking is relevant to any topic that you may want to open up upon moving to the Free State. More Info

For Whom: If you live in, once lived in, or have moved from, Massachusetts Description: Come meet others currently living or from Massachusetts. You traveled far to get here and so did they! . . Find out where they live. Look for someone who live(d) close to you. What liberty events they do/did there. What events are you looking forward to this week? Make plans to meet again at another event, and perhaps when you get back home.” Facilitator: Dennis Pratt, Chef de Village of PF 2023, 2022, 2021. Founder of The SHELL, Independence Inn, Free State Tours. blah blah blah Lived in Massachusetts for 40 years. MIT blah blah blah. Website . Image When: Wed, 10:00A _(30m) Where: FSP: Free State Live Stage, Penisula Note: We'll have regional meetings Wed morning -> early afternoon. If you're from multiple states, consider coming to other meetups.

For Whom: If you have already volunteered to help out at PF2022. . . . If you would like to volunteer and help out at PF2022 . . . If you are a coordinator of PF2022 Description: All volunteers of PorcFest XX 2023 gather together to appreciate the work we have done, and the gift we are about to bestow on three thousand liberty lovers yearning for freedom. Organizer: Constance Spencer, Constance is our co-producer for PorcFest XX 2023. Having volunteered to manage Registration for the last five years, Constance is stepping up this year PorcFest Operations Direct, responsible for all the internal operations of PorcFest (Registration, Free Aid, Facilities, PorcRangers, Inventory, Info, Costs, Rogers relations, etc.) . . . When not volunteering to manage the complex operations of the largest freedom festival in the world, Constance is the lead of Independence Realty Group which is a real estate team at Coldwell Banker Realty. . . . She is an early mover for the Free State Project moving from Alaska in 2014 with her four children. In Alaska she was learning self-reliance by turning her small acreage home into a homestead through permaculture and raising chickens, ducks, turkeys, and pigs. She was also active in the home birth community and has always allowed her children education freedom which has included homeschooling, trade schools, and charter schools. . . . She has also been a real estate investor since her early twenties when she rented her single family home in Ohio and moved to Alaska. She and her partner currently have 13 rental units. Her passion is helping others navigate home ownership and real estate investing. She’s just as comfortable talking about peaceful parenting as she is discussing holding real estate in retirement accounts and sees both as paths to liberty. . . . Visit her hub at "Homeland" on the field.. Website . Image Chef de Village, PorcFest XX 2023: Dennis Pratt, This is Dennis' fifth and final year volunteering to coordinate PorcFest, and his third year as co-producer/"Chef de Village". He is in charge of positioning, events, hubs, speakers, sponsors, marketing, and revenues. . . . Dennis reimagined PorcFest in 2020 to align more with our FSP goals to attract liberty lovers to the Free State, and to connect and activate those liberty lovers to build greater liberty. . . . Dennis has found refuge in the Free State over the last four and a half years, having suffered decades in authoritarian states. Don't let his galootish looks fool you! Rolling up his sleeves, he has become one of the Free State's most entrepreneurial volunteers, starting up liberty clubhouses (including the famous SHELL), liberty bus tours, liberty events. a liberty inn. In a myriad other ways, he connects liberty lovers together and inspires them to build. He's an ethicist, well known amongst really nerdy circles. You can hear him talk in the Liberty 101 hub, when he's not driving around, with his wife Carol and his pup Ron Paw, making sure everything's copacetic. . . . He was this year's NH Liberty Activist of the Year, and the Keynote Speaker for NH Liberty Forum. He's a hugger, so warn him off if he gets too close!. Website . Image When: Tue, 10:00A _(60m) Where: FSP: Free State Live Stage, Penisula Note: We will have a meeting of all volunteers each day at 9A at the Free State Live stage. This, being the official Opening Day, is our first meeting, and delayed an hour. Functional groups meet right after this to prepare for opening at noon.

In Alaska she was learning self-reliance by turning her small acreage home into a homestead through permaculture and raising chickens, ducks, turkeys, and pigs. She was also active in the home birth community and has always allowed her children education freedom which has included homeschooling, trade schools, and charter schools. . . . She has also been a real estate investor since her early twenties when she rented her single family home in Ohio and moved to Alaska. She and her partner currently have 13 rental units. Her passion is helping others navigate home ownership and real estate investing. She’s just as comfortable talking about peaceful parenting as she is discussing holding real estate in retirement accounts and sees both as paths to liberty. . . . Visit her hub at "Homeland" on the field.. Website . Image Chef de Village, PorcFest XX 2023: Dennis Pratt, This is Dennis' fifth and final year volunteering to coordinate PorcFest, and his third year as co-producer/"Chef de Village". He is in charge of positioning, events, hubs, speakers, sponsors, marketing, and revenues. . . . Dennis reimagined PorcFest in 2020 to align more with our FSP goals to attract liberty lovers to the Free State, and to connect and activate those liberty lovers to build greater liberty. . . . Dennis has found refuge in the Free State over the last four and a half years, having suffered decades in authoritarian states. Don't let his galootish looks fool you! Rolling up his sleeves, he has become one of the Free State's most entrepreneurial volunteers, starting up liberty clubhouses (including the famous SHELL), liberty bus tours, liberty events. a liberty inn. In a myriad other ways, he connects liberty lovers together and inspires them to build. He's an ethicist, well known amongst really nerdy circles. You can hear him talk in the Liberty 101 hub, when he's not driving around, with his wife Carol and his pup Ron Paw, making sure everything's copacetic. . . . He was this year's NH Liberty Activist of the Year, and the Keynote Speaker for NH Liberty Forum. He's a hugger, so warn him off if he gets too close!. Website . Image When: Wed, 9:00A _(30m) Where: FSP: Free State Live Stage, Penisula

summary: AMA with Carolann Fenton & Seamus Casey Mrs.Kin [FSP]
description: For Whom: Visitors and newcomers curious about the Free State Project Description: Seamus Casey developed GenCourt mobile, an essential tool for local political activists, and continues to actively encourage movers to take part in NH state politics. Meanwhile, Carolann Fenton has been making waves in crypto investment circles as managing Director and COO at Chainstone Labs, Project Manager of Watchdog Capital, and co-host on Satoshi Roundtable. Now they are both serving on the FSP board. Come with your questions!! Moderator: Mrs.Kin When: Tue, 2:00P _(60m) Where: FSP: Free State Live, Penisula More Info

For Whom:  Visitors and newcomers curious about the Free State Project
Description: A founder of LBRY and Odysee, former Executive Director of the Free State Project and recent LP senate candidate, Jeremy Kauffman uses innovative technology and attention-grabbing social media to raise the profile of New Hampshire as a libertarian homeland. Currently, Jeremy is a serving member of the FSP board and leader of our Comms Team volunteers. Come with your questions!!
Moderator: Mrs.Kin
When: Fri, 2:00P _(60m)
Where: FSP: Free State Live, Penisula

For Whom:  Visitors and newcomers curious about the Free State Project
Description: Carla Gericke, "Queen Quill," is the primary spokesperson for Free State Project. Currently chairwoman of the board, she is also a former FSP executive director and PorcFest Organizer. Carla is open about her personal story of immigration to U.S. from South Africa, transforming her health and well-being through diet, and connecting with libertarian activists and neighbors here in the Free State. Come with your questions!!
Moderator: Mrs.Kin

Where: FSP: Free State Live, Penisula

summary: Coffee with a Coordinator: Dennis Pratt Dennis Pratt [FSP]
description: For Whom: Visitors and newcomers curious about the "behind the scenes" of coordinating PorcFest and the amazing volunteers who run it. Description: Dennis Pratt shares his experiences moving to the Free State, exploring the various groups, finding his place by volunteering at PorcFest, first at the "Community Tent", and then eventually redesigning the festival and becoming its first Chief de Ville Speaker: Dennis Pratt, Dennis is the Chef de Village of PorcFest, NH's Liberty Activist of the Year, and the Keynote Speaker at NH Liberty Forum. 42 years a libertarian, he was the number 1 writer on libertarian topics on the competitive intellectual essay site Quora before being deplatformed. He moved to the Free State 4.5 years ago to become the consummate volunteer, building our Libertarian Homeland, starting the famous SHELL libertarian clubhouse, opening the Independence Inn, leading liberty bus tours, raising hell with the nefarious LPNH, and tweeting about libertarian ethics and the Free State. This is his fifth and last year volunteering to lead PorcFest. Catch his daily talks at Liberty 101 on libertarianism. His background is new product design in emerging industries, MIT and Northwestern, and 42 years married to wife Carol. He has daughter Vivian and dog Ron Paw.. Website . Image When: Sat, 10:00A _(60m) Where: FSP: Free State Live, Penisula

summary: What the FSP? - Welcome home! Tim Bauman, Patrick Binder, Jack Garber, Calvin Beaulier [FSP]
description:
For Whom: New movers or those planning their move to NH
Description: What the FSP? is a series of talks and panels about what the Free State Project organization does, and a few things you may be surprised to learn are done by others....

Welcome home! Potlucks & local connections 

After you move to New Hampshire, you'll be encouraged by the FSP Moving Director Chris Lopez, your friends online, and your new neighbors to go to a new mover potluck or a local liberty meetup. Who runs these events? Who and what are they for? Come find out more as we discuss the emergent order of potlucks and how to build local connections with event hosts from across the state.
Panelist: Tim Bauman, Host of Ossipee Porcupines Meetup
Panelist: Patrick Binder, Manchester New Mover Potluck MC, former host of Manchester Market Day
Panelist: Jack Garber, Host of SHELL New Mover Brunch
Panelist: Calvin Beaulier, Occasional host of North Country Porcupines Potluck
When: Tue, 5:00P _(60m)
Where: FSP: Free State Live, Penisula
Note: Find liberty events in your region of NH on fsp.org/calendar

summary: Free Pancakes at the PorcuPint Hall Tony Olsen [PINT]
description: For Whom: Anyone who likes pancakes, especially people who believe in extreme levels of social & economic freedom, who believe that taxation is theft, and who want to leave the next generation with freedoms that were stolen from us before we were born. Description: Tony Olsen brings pancakes and Freedom Haven project to the PorcuPint hall. . . . Just eat pancakes and socialize or discuss how the Free-Market at Freedom Haven project can benefit the next generation. . . . Come discover more about what today's high seas industries can offer all members of your families and support our marketing campaign if this is a path you would like for us to take. Help us reach our $2,000 marketing campaign goal for 2023. : Tony Olsen, Chief Architect: Tony Olsen, This guy loves making pancakes and loves meeting fellow pro-freedom people. Website When: Thu, 12:00P (120m) Where: PINT: Porcupints, Bingo More Info

summary: Porcupint Market- Children vending to serve you! StephAnie Buzzell [PINT]
description:
For Whom: EVERYONE! Seriously though… ANYONE who wants to support the children of PorcFest as they learn the ropes of agorism should stop by this market. Don’t miss it! You’ll make a child’s day and may find something you love in the process!
Description: Come support our growing porcupines at the 3rd Annual PorcuPint Children's Market- Stop by the market to shop from our youngest entrepreneurs. Make a purchase for yourself, for a gift or just browse and pass on a word of encouragement! You never know what you'll be able to find at this creative market. Past endeavors have included: plant seedlings, garden gnomes, sweet treats, bug spray, painted rocks & crystals, crafts, and more!
. . . (Have children at PorcFest who want to vend at this market? Set up is 10:30-11a. Children are encouraged to be creative with their wares)...
Organizer: StephAnie Buzzell
When: Thu, 11:00A _(90m)
Where: PINT: Porcupints, Bingo

summary: Homeopathy for Healing: An Introduction Sarah Thompson [PINT]
description: For Whom: Families (or anyone) interested in learning about healing with homeopathy. Description: Join Sarah Thompson, of Inner Sea Homeopathy, for an informative session on using homeopathy for both acute and chronic conditions. Learn more about Sarah at innerseahomeopathy.com, schedule a free call, and connect with her in advance if you wish to schedule a time to meet for consultation at Porcfest. Sarah will be available at Sarah's Homeopathy Hub for the week, at site 243. Speaker: Sarah Thompson. Website When: Tue, 11:00A _(60m) Where: PINT: Porcupints, Bingo More Info

For Whom: Families (or anyone) who would like to learn how to stock an herbal first aid kit Description: What's in your first aid kit? Do you want more natural options? Come learn about the essentials for a natural first aid kit. What you should have on hand and when to use it. : Kathryn Michelotti When: Wed, 9:00A _(60m) Where: PINT: Porcupints, Bingo More Info

For Whom: Families (or anyone) interested in beekeeping Description: Want to add bees to your homestead? Or just curious to learn more about the beekeeping process? Come learn beekeeping basics, see some equipment and ask questions! : Daniel When: Tue, 9:00A _(60m) Where: PINT: Porcupints, Bingo More Info

For Whom: Kids (and parents) who would like to hear about how kids CAN operate businesses Description: You're never too young (or old) for agorism! Come hear from 11-year old Faizal, of Zombie Defense, as he explains how he started and runs his business. His Porcfest business is a component of his homeschooling experience. He has spent the last few months studying products on Ali Baba and negotiating a bulk purchase from a vendor in Shenzhen. Come learn about his business model and ask questions! Speaker: Faizal Shortell, Faizal is 11 years old, in 6th grade and attending PorcFest for the 3rd year. His hub Zombie Defense is a great place to stop by to pick up a blowgun, a cool knife, perhaps a slingshot or maybe even a flashlight or walkie talkie. If you are not into the tools of the zombie-fighting craft, then perhaps you will find a toy or your favorite candy here. Either way, stop by and say hello. Bonus points if you stop in with your Pokemon and declare a challenge!. Website When: Wed, 12:00P _(60m) Where: PINT: Porcupints, Bingo More Info

For Whom: Kids and parents (or anyone) who want to practice firestarting skills! Description: Want to learn how to use a firesteel? Firesteel is joining us at PorcuPints to teach you how! Watch a “Fire-starting 101” demo and then try it out for yourself. Impress your friends! Impress yourself! With a FireSteel.com firesteel you’ll never be cold again. Love it and want one too? Stop by the Firesteel Shop anytime to get their best-selling firesteel or to enter their raffle. There’s something for every fire-starting skill level at the FireSteel.com SHOP. 🔥 : Ilma (Ron). Website When: Thu, 1:00P _(60m) Where: PINT: Porcupints, Bingo More Info

summary: State vs. federal Citizenship: Choices Christopher Gronski [PINT]
description: For Whom: Parents who want to learn more about state vs federal citizenship and choices you can be making for your family Description: Is your child (or you) a state or federal citizen? Most people do not even know they have a choice. Come hear about the choices you have for your family and imagine how much you could invest in your family's future if you did not have to pay an income tax to the podophiles in the District of Columbia? Speaker: Christopher Gronski, Living in New Hampshire since 1987, Christopher has a great concern for America as he sees the local, state and federal governments disregard the Rights of the People worldwide. . . . New Hampshire’s state motto “Live Free or Die”, declares his sentiment and commitment to the Freedom movement here in America. . . . Christopher Gronski – Freedom Biography . . . Living in New Hampshire since 1987, Christopher Gronski has been studying Federal jurisdiction and tax laws for over 20 years and has been a Freedom Consultant for many Freedom minded people from around the country and world. . . . Christopher was the New Hampshire State Coordinator for We The People (www.givemeliberty.org) for over 10 years and is New Hampshire’s current President of Freedom Force International. (www.freedom–force.org). He has been an active in supporting the Free State Project (www.freestateproject.org) since its inception and has been a guest speaker at FSP’s PorcFest and Liberty Forum. . . . Christopher was a Selectman (Town Council) for the Town of Hill, New Hampshire. He has worked with New Hampshire State Representatives to write and pass laws that restrict government and protect Rights. He successfully works with the U.S. State Department in acquiring United States Passports for State Citizens, without being U.S. (federal, 14th Amendment) citizens. His State Citizenship work has includes the New Hampshire State Department, Department of Transportation and New Hampshire Superior Court. . . . Christopher teaches State Citizenship Classes Online and helps people eliminate various forms of debt, including dealing with the IRS and setting up Foreign Trust Organizations. . . . Christopher is happily married and has two adult children.. Website When: Thu, 2:00P _(60m) Where: PINT: Porcupints, Bingo

For Whom: Families Description: Come hang out with your friends at Pints, the pool or the playground for a PorcuPint farewell! Bring a picnic lunch, play games, exchange phone numbers, etc. Then at 2, head down to the field to continue the celebration. Group photo and pig roast welcomes you. PorcFest is out of this world and there's no better way to express that than the rocket launch. And last but not least, PorcFest wraps up with the annual burning porcupine. Enjoy! : StephAnie Buzzell When: Sat, 12:00P (120m) Where: PINT: Porcupints, Bingo More Info

For Whom: Those who understand that socioeconomic freedom produces prosperity and want a world with more of it. Description: The ambitious 19-year-long Freedom Haven project’s goal is to bring the highest levels of freedom in the world to thousands of people who seek it. In this presentation, you'll learn what the Freedom Haven is and how its' free markets can help thousands of the 25 million refugees in the world today. Speaker: Anthony Olsen, As lead architect in the Freedom Haven project, Tony knows the technical details of the project and how it will work.. Website . Image When: Fri, 2:00P _(60m) Where: PINT: Porcupints, Bingo More Info

For Whom: Babysitters and Families in need of care Description: Want to babysit or need a sitter? Come meet and mingle! Exchange information and connect to see if you are a good fit for each other. Babysitters may be older children/teens OR parents willing to exchange care with other families. +++ Babysitters (teens/parents willing to exchange care): Fill out the form by June 11 for your information to be compiled and shared with families in need. Responses will be shared in the PorcuPint telegram group and posted at the PorcuPint hub. Missed the form? Add your information in person at PorcFest. https://forms.gle/qkveYTZYusaPiEqw8 **Babysitters and families are not screened. Please do your own due diligence to ensure it is a good fit.** : StephAnie Buzzell. Website When: Mon, 3:30P _(30m) Where: PINT: Porcupints, Bingo More Info

Drop-ins welcome on a first come, first served basis. Signing up below reserves a rocket for you at the building event. Please contact the organizer in advance if you know you will not make it to the building time, but still want to participate in rocket launching Saturday. Ages 10+ OR under 10 with adult assistance required. description: For Whom: PorcuPint families and friends Description: Tacos, balloon animals, juggling, activities, games and more. Join PorcuPint families for a taco dinner. Taco meat generously provided by Bardo Farm! Taco meat, vegan bean filling, and rice provided. Any food contributions are welcome for the potluck or if potlucks aren't your thing, you could pack a picnic dinner for your family and join us for the fun! summary: Pop Up Adventure Playground (sheet painting) Moira, StephAnie Buzzell [PINT]
description: For Whom: Children Description: Pop up Playground! Add your paint "signature" to the sheet to kick off the PorcuPint Pop up playground. All ages welcome for sheet painting. Pop up playground will be available all week for ages birth-6. Location and times tbd, Pop Up style! Ask at toddler-K morning meet up or at PorcuPints daily for location. See link for more info: https://youtu.be/Vc9nBmxQ8r4 : Moira, Moira’s decision to become a mother was a pivotal moment in her life and because of this, in the spring of 2016, she began to develop the concept of a new business model to support childhood learning. This idea was born out of Moira’s desire to help other parents on their journey out of what currently passes for "education" and into something that empowered children to take leadership in their own learning process. By 2017, as a free local initiative, Moira started “Albany Pop-Up Adventure Playground” - a temporary play space filled with loose parts and objects designed to inspire imagination and creativity. By the time of the lockdowns, more than 700 people had attended the pop-ups, which Moira designed in her own local community as an opportunity for all children to have access to child-led play.. Website : StephAnie Buzzell, When: Tue, 10:00A (120m) Where: PINT: Porcupints, Bingo More Info
