summary: Learn to Juggle StephAnie Buzzell, Michael South [PINT]
description:
For Whom: Anyone who wants to learn juggling!
Description: Informal, drop-in anytime: Learn to Juggle with scarves (great for beginners because it slows down gravity). Scarves provided. If your kid will be super into this, you might like to bring three juggling-friendly beanbags (preferred for the novice because they don't bounce all over when dropped. There are various tutorials online to make your own. You can also purchase them pretty inexpensively. If you have a kid that already knows how to juggle and wants to learn slightly more advanced stuff, like passing with another juggler, I'm happy to help with that, too (but it might have to be after the main "session").  Finally, if you have a kid that can juggle five, maybe they can teach me. 🙂
: StephAnie Buzzell
: Michael South, 
When: Tue, 5:30P _(90m)
Where: PINT: Porcupints, Bingo

For Whom: EVERYONE who wants to watch and any talented children/teens
Description: Come show off your talent. Did you learn to juggle this week? Do you play an instrument? Sing? Dance? Can you solve a rubik's cube super fast? Got magic tricks or some other talent up your sleeve? Show us what you've got! Please keep acts to 3-5 minutes or shorter. Acts in order of sign in upon arrival. No try-outs or pre-registrations. This show will not be judged but is just an opportunity to show off talents to a friendly audience. 

Did you LOVE something you saw? After the show "swap" your talents. You can answer questions about your talent or teach others your tricks (if you want to!)
: Stephanie Buzzell
When: Fri, 10:30A _(90m)
Where: PINT: Porcupints, Bingo

For Whom: Children, families, and liberty fam- while supplies last
Description: Come decorate Porcupine sugar cookies for dessert. Artificial dye free. Gluten-free and vegan options available (please ask as they will be separate/"hidden" to reserve for those in need of them. Please note: Ingredients will be listed though cookies are not baked in an allergen-free environment and may contain cross-contamination.)
: Stephanie Buzzell
When: Mon, 6:30P _(30m)
Where: PINT: Porcupints, Bingo

For Whom: Attendees of the historic, largest ever, most baed PorcFest XX 2023!
Description: The closing of the official  festival takes place with the Burning of the Porcupine. Come, share a light, say farewell to the festival, talk with your fellow porcupines about how you can advance liberty in your lifetime -- outside of PorcFest… 
…and prepare for the night.


When: Sat, 8:30P _(90m)

Where: Field: Field, Field

More Info: https://freemarketanarchist.files.wordpress.com/2008/06/burning_porc1.jpg?w=444&h=598
Chef de Village: Dennis Pratt, One of your principal guides over the last five years, our Chef de Village Dennis is hanging up his official leadership with XX.  Give him a big hug!
Organizer: Constance Spencer, Constance is our co-producer for PorcFest XX 2023.  Having volunteered to manage Registration for the last five years, Constance is stepping up this year PorcFest Operations Direct, responsible for all the internal operations of PorcFest (Registration, Free Aid, Facilities, PorcRangers, Inventory, Info, Costs, Rogers relations, etc.)
. . . When not volunteering to manage the complex operations of the largest freedom festival in the world, Constance is the lead of Independence Realty Group which is a real estate team at Coldwell Banker Realty.
. . . She is an early mover for the Free State Project moving from Alaska in 2014 with her four children. In Alaska she was learning self-reliance by turning her small acreage home into a homestead through permaculture and raising chickens, ducks, turkeys, and pigs. She was also active in the home birth community and has always allowed her children education freedom which has included homeschooling, trade schools, and charter schools.
. . . She has also been a real estate investor since her early twenties when she rented her single family home in Ohio and moved to Alaska. She and her partner currently have 13 rental units. Her passion is helping others navigate home ownership and real estate investing. She’s just as comfortable talking about peaceful parenting as she is discussing holding real estate in retirement accounts and sees both as paths to liberty.
. . . Visit her hub at "Homeland" on the field.
When: Sat, 8:30P (100m)
Where: FLD: Field, Field

summary: Photo Shoot: Official PorcFest XX Group Photo Constance Spencer [FLD]
description:
For Whom: Every PorcFest attendee of 2023 -- old and young; newbie and old-timer,' sober or not; politicos, agorists, ancaps, beltways, preppers, curious, spouses; Christians, Jews, Muslims, atheists; speakers and listeners; campers and hotelers; 
. . . The only people who should not be down in the field for this photo are Feds.

Description: Attention! Attention! All attendees gather on the field for our annual group photo, so that we can tell the world there exists a small group - which is far larger than they think - of freedom lovers willing to travel -- and some even migrate -- to create Liberty in our Lifetime. 
Director of Operations: Constance Spencer, Constance is our co-producer for PorcFest XX 2023.  Having volunteered to manage Registration for the last five years, Constance is stepping up this year PorcFest Operations Direct, responsible for all the internal operations of PorcFest (Registration, Free Aid, Facilities, PorcRangers, Inventory, Info, Costs, Rogers relations, etc.)
. . . When not volunteering to manage the complex operations of the largest freedom festival in the world, Constance is the lead of Independence Realty Group which is a real estate team at Coldwell Banker Realty.
. . . She is an early mover for the Free State Project moving from Alaska in 2014 with her four children. In Alaska she was learning self-reliance by turning her small acreage home into a homestead through permaculture and raising chickens, ducks, turkeys, and pigs. She was also active in the home birth community and has always allowed her children education freedom which has included homeschooling, trade schools, and charter schools.
. . . She has also been a real estate investor since her early twenties when she rented her single family home in Ohio and moved to Alaska. She and her partner currently have 13 rental units. Her passion is helping others navigate home ownership and real estate investing. She’s just as comfortable talking about peaceful parenting as she is discussing holding real estate in retirement accounts and sees both as paths to liberty.
. . . Visit her hub at "Homeland" on the field.
When: Sat, 2:30P _(30m)
Where: FLD: Field, Field
Note: This photo shares with the world the number and type of attendees. It is the culmination of our festival. If you don't like your photo taken, turn backwards, or wear a disguise. But please do attend to show the world how many there are of us who really don't like the State and are willing to explore migrating to create on small region for Liberty In Our Lifetime.
. . . NO FEDS though.

For Whom: Everyone who has attended this PorcFest: Vendor and vendee; hub organizers and hub attendees; speakers and listeners; families and singles. Description: Find and gather your campsite, your hubs, your friends, your associates all together and make your way down to the field for our annual photo. Bring symbols of your clan -- matching t-shirts, banners, signs, etc. And surround yourself with your clan and your friends for our annual PorcFest (XX) photoshoot. . . . Themes of similar shirts, hats, colors etc are always good. Banners, signs, etc. Chef de Village: Dennis Pratt, Will be traipsing around the campground calling out you guys, as he has done in past years.. Please head down to field early -- so he can actually make it into this year's picture (He was too busy corralling laggards in 2021 that he missed the photo entirely!). Website . Image When: Sat, 2:00P _(30m) Where: FLD: Field, Field Note: Make sure the people you care about know about the upcoming photoshoot and herd them down to the field so they can mark this historic moment with you.

summary: Doggy Meetup on the Field Ron Paw [FLD]
description: For Whom: Four legged. Tail (cropped acceptable) but ever-wagging. Ears pointy, or floppy. Friendly. Greeting. Licks and belly rubs acceptable Responsible owners only please! Description: A classic of PF. Police the field while your dog meets his best tail-wagging buds. Please have your dog under control, and pick up any poop immediately. While you're chatting, do help clear the field of bottles, etc that the less-than-responsible may have left last night. Leave the field ready for the day! Belgian Tervuren: Ron Paw, Ron Paw has sniffed around the Free State for two and a half years now, and declares it is safe for all Porcupines. His first PF was 2021, but he was only a pup. Last year, was his teenage experience. This year he comes in as a young adult. He reclaims his title as Chef du Jeu of PF 2023, along with his 5 year old cockapoo companion, Queen Janey.. Image When: Tue, 8:00A _(60m) Where: FLD: Field, Field Note: Doggies play 8A and 5P on the field each day.

summary: Intro to Renaissance Dance (Weather Permitting) Rebecca Friedman [FLD]
description:
For Whom: If you enjoy physical activity, love music, or are a dancer, this event is probably a good fit!
Description: Come learn some dances from the English Renaissance! No steps more complicated than walking required, but a lot more fun! English Country Dance is an ancestor of squaredancing and contra, which was practiced from late Elizabethan England through into the regency (we will focus on the earliest dances). No need to dress up, no need to dress down, come as you wish to be and have fun with us!
Leader: Rebecca Friedman, I've been doing Renaissance dance since I was five years old, and have taught it for the last fifteen.

summary: Maj Toure - Meet, Greet and Graze Maj Toure, Jack Garber, TBD [HOME]
description: For Whom: Those at PorcFest who would like to meet Maj Toure in a casual setting. Description: Maj Toure, a native of North Philadelphia, founded the educational nonprofit organization Black Guns Matter in 2016. The organization advocates for the right to keep and bear arms and promotes responsible ownership of firearms within African-American and urban communities. Toure was a candidate for an at-large seat in the Philadelphia City Council in the city's 2019 election. He ran as a Libertarian. In addition to his support for Second Amendment rights, his stated political priorities included: criminal justice reform; ending the practice of solitary confinement; legalization of cannabis; improved education in Philadelphia; and conflict resolution training for disconnected youths. Politician & Celebrity : Maj Toure, He is the real Maj Toure.. Website . Image When: Thu, 10:00A _(60m) Where: HOME: HOMELAND, Field Note: Maj Toure is the founder of Black Guns Matter (BGM) and Black Libertarianism Movement (BLM) More Info

For Whom: Attendee who want to get up close and personal with Maj Toure. Description: Maj Toure, a native of North Philadelphia, founded the educational nonprofit organization Black Guns Matter in 2016. The organization advocates for the right to keep and bear arms and promotes responsible ownership of firearms within African-American and urban communities. He has released three rap/hip hop recordings: Solutionary Vol. 1 (2005), Solutionary Vol. 2 (2014), and Solutionary Vol. 3 (2016). Toure was a candidate for an at-large seat in the Philadelphia City Council in the city's 2019 election. Speaker: Maj Toure, Maj Toure, a native of North Philadelphia, founded the educational nonprofit organization Black Guns Matter in 2016. The organization advocates for the right to keep and bear arms and promotes responsible ownership of firearms within African-American and urban communities. He has released three rap/hip hop recordings: Solutionary Vol. 1 (2005), Solutionary Vol. 2 (2014), and Solutionary Vol. 3 (2016). Toure was a candidate for an at-large seat in the Philadelphia City Council in the city's 2019 election. He ran as a Libertarian. In addition to his support for Second Amendment rights, his stated political priorities included: criminal justice reform; ending the practice of solitary confinement; legalization of cannabis; improved education in Philadelphia; and conflict resolution training for disconnected youths. On November 5, 2019, Toure finished 15th in a field of 17 candidates in the city's election, failing to secure a seat on the City Council. He received 5,676 votes (0.5% of the vote total).. Website . summary: State of the Market in NH Constance Spencer [HOME]
description: For Whom: People who need housing or market information Description: New Hampshire's real estate market is flourishing with high demand and low inventory. According to a report by the New Hampshire Association of Realtors, the median sales price of a single-family home has increased by 8.2% from last year. The state's low unemployment rate and an influx of out-of-state buyers are the primary reasons for this growth. However, this market has created a limited supply for affordable homes, making them more challenging to find. Our team lead and real estate broker, Constance Spencer will talk to you about the market and how to be successful moving the the Libertarian Homeland! Organizer: Constance Spencer, Constance is our co-producer for PorcFest XX 2023. Having volunteered to manage Registration for the last five years, Constance is stepping up this year PorcFest Operations Direct, responsible for all the internal operations of PorcFest. (Registration, Free Aid, Facilities, PorcRangers, Inventory, Info, Costs, Rogers relations, etc.) When not volunteering to manage the complex operations of the largest freedom festival in the world, Constance is the lead of Independence Realty Group which is a real estate team at Coldwell Banker Realty. She is an early mover for the Free State Project moving from Alaska in 2014 with her four children. In Alaska she was learning self-reliance by turning her small acreage home into a homestead through permaculture and raising chickens, ducks, turkeys, and pigs. She was also active in the home birth community and has always allowed her children education freedom which has included homeschooling, trade schools, and charter schools. She has also been a real estate investor since her early twenties when she rented her single family home in Ohio and moved to Alaska. She and her partner currently have 13 rental units. Her passion is helping others navigate home ownership and real estate investing. She’s just as comfortable talking about peaceful parenting as she is discussing holding real estate in retirement accounts and sees both as paths to liberty. Visit her hub at "Homeland" on the field.. Website . Image When: Tue, 10:30A _(90m) Where: HOME: HOMELAND, Field Note: After the talk there will be time to ask questions of the Independence Realty Group's agents. More Info

With the potential for lucrative returns, real estate investment can be a great addition to any portfolio. Speaker: , Marco Capaldi, Marco Capaldi 3rd yr Porcfest attendee and a business owner has helped over 30 people to date downsize to one level luxurious living. Inventor and Designer Tomek Sadowski a native of Poland is the OEM in Poland of a line of Galvanized Steel Framed Tiny Homes all built to high EU energy standards with radiant flooring and customizable modern materials and solar, wind, and battery options. These are designed with adding livable space in stages and there is a free standing home office and spa model that can be added to an existing home on telescoping piers and in one day without molesting your yard and landscaping. Tom and Marco are committed to hiring Ukranian displaced workers in Poland to build these homes. Our system of install and one day delivery is award winning. Also our prices are as low as $250 a sq ft 1/3 of modern building costs. We also furnish them through our subsidiary as well as provide all appliances in our base package.
When: Wed, 9:00A (120m)
Where: HOME: HOMELAND, Field

For Whom: Anyone interested in Homesteading
Description: Homesteading vs Hobby Farm. The real daily grind of a owning, running and living on a modern homestead. Homesteading in New Hampshire is not anything like the TV show "Green Acres".
Moderator: Jack Garber
When: Wed, 1:00P _(60m)
Where: HOME: HOMELAND, Field

summary: Author Skoti Elliott - Book Release Skoti Elliott [HOME]
description: For Whom: Ages 11+ Description: Join us for the return of Skoti-Alain Elliott, known for his fun & thought-provoking presentations on Critical Thinking: Mind over Murder. This year, Skoti is excited to present his new book, November Comes Around, which is the first installment in the Chronicles of Quinn & Cooper series. The story takes place on a deserted island where Quinn & Cooper must rely on their critical thinking skills to stay alive. Speaker: Skoti Elliott, Skoti-Alain Elliott has a strong background in physics, acoustics, and electronics. He began his career designing, building, and maintaining A-list recording studios in NYC. He then transitioned to engineering and mixing records, earning him several Platinum and Gold records. In 2004, he made a career change to web and software development. Skoti discovered his passion for teaching while instructing Audio Engineering at NYU and later teaching Application Development as a freelance instructor. That experience led him to create The Rational Apprentice (therationalapprentice.com). Skoti believes that making well-informed decisions, whether it's selecting the right microphone, writing the best algorithms, or making everyday choices in life, is directly related to obtaining quality information and using critical, rational, and logical thinking techniques.. Website When: Fri, 12:00P _(60m) Where: HOME: HOMELAND, Field Note: During the event, Skoti will read excerpts from the book and generously gift complimentary copies to three audience members. Enjoy a light lunch and beverage while listening to this engaging presentation. More Info

summary: Life is Good: Morning AA meeting Mark Hansen [FIRE]
description:
For Whom: For anybody who is sober or trying to stay sober during the week, and for anybody who might be having a difficult time with substances and trying to stop. Are alcohol or other substances becoming overwhelming,  consuming, or taking over your life? Habits can become addictions for some people, and when it becomes a problem, it may be time to stop. When your body gets used to having foreign substances in it every day (such as alcohol), it may be physiologically very difficult to stop or change the habit/addiction. I’ve found it more helpful to talk with others who have actually gone through it, than to talk with counselors who haven’t. —Mark
Description: A morning group for those who will not be drinking and/or participating in extracurricular substances who would like to have a coffee, chat, or support and encourage each other to stay sober. 
Organizer: Mark Hansen, Mark Hansen, Mark has been sober for over 8 years. He realized that alcohol was becoming a problem in his life, and didn’t want to be remembered as being an alcoholic. He didn’t want his children to remember him that way, and he didn’t want alcohol to take his life. As a former park ranger and security officer at a hospital, he has seen his fair share of what alcohol addiction can do to a person. He has witnessed people going through detox. He has seen the physical and psychological effects of it, and he has seen people die from alcoholism and drug overdose. He didn’t want alcohol to win, so he decided to be a warrior to defeat it. Mark is teaching special education again, hiking, riding motorcycles, and enjoying the 2A and shooting sports these days. He is truly grateful to God (his higher power) for saving his life, and he’s giving credit where credit is due. Be a warrior. Life is Good. 
When: Tue, 9:00A _(60m)
Where: FIRE: 🔥The FireSteel.com Event Canopy🔥, RV13

For Whom: Knitters, Crocheters, Embroiderers, Tatters, Felters, Leatherworkers, Cross Stitchers, Needlepointers, Sewers, Spinners, Crafters, Beaders, etc, etc, etc, are all welcome to join us for some good old fashioned "Stitchin' an' Bitchin'". Bring a project and a drinking mug. We'll have hot water for tea, coffee, and maybe a sewing machine or two to use. Want to learn how to do these things? Come on over and we'll answer your questions and offer suggestions, but know that this is meant to be an informal hangout group, not a formal teaching class. Check out the separate teaching classes scattered throughout the schedule or watch a bunch of tutorials online so you can have a basic idea of what's involved. What are you waiting for? Come meet your new BFFs at this year's "Daily Stitch & Bitch"! Description: "Stitch and Bitch" groups have been around since before WWII, when they were composed primarily of knitters. In modern times, the S&B movement has gradually expanded to include all manner of crafters and fiber artists. Our PorcFest edition will of the modern type and will be a daily happening from noon to 2 PM at the FireSteel.com Canopy located at RV13. Organizer: Ilma & Friends, Ilma (the organizer) first learned how to crochet at the age of 8, and then 20 years later she learned how to knit in order to teach an actor to look legit while performing in a play that required knitting. She then proceeded to forget all about both of these techniques until about 12 years ago when her daughter needed help with some crochet stitches and she took up her hooks again. Then she took up her needles. Now she's got more projects than time. It's a certainty that all the other S&B-ers have similar stories. Come join us and tell us your own!. Website When: Mon, 12:00P (120m) Where: FIRE: 🔥The FireSteel.com Event Canopy🔥, RV13 More Info

description: For Whom: Political activists, people with ideas about how to leverage the Croydon Budget Battle experience Description: We lost the battle, but we can still win the war. After the presentation about the Croydon Budget Battle (Pavilion, 2pm), we invite people to brainstorm how lessons learned from our experience can be used for other people's political activism. A newly published "bare minimum" book about the Croydon Budget Battle will also be available for purchase and autograph by the author. Leader: Ian Underwood, Ian Underwood was the person who instigated the Croydon Budget Battle. Leader: Jody Underwood, Jody Underwood, then chair of the Croydon school board, had to clean up the mess that Ian instigated. description:
For Whom: 
Description:

For Whom: People who want to learn to knit. If you know how to knit, come hang out and/or help the beginners. Description: Have you always wanted to try knitting or want to get re-acquainted? Join us for a beginner class. We will learn the basics, and when you're done you can keep going to make a garter stitch scarf! We will also talk about how knitting is not just a fun hobby, but can be a useful skill for survival and self-sufficiency. Instructor: Karen, Karen has been a knitter for many years and likes teaching people things. When: Tue, 10:00A _(60m) Where: FIRE: 🔥The FireSteel.com Event Canopy🔥, RV13 Note: What to bring: - Knitting needles in size US 7 or larger, - A ball of *light colored* yarn that works with your needles. - Willingness to learn, patience, and acceptance of mistakes Note: We will have a very limited amount of supplies to learn with, but you will not be able to take them with you. More Info

For Whom: Curious about Crochet? Then come to this basic class/overview of the foundation techniques. If you have them, bring those crochet hooks that have been taunting you in the corner gathering dust. If you don't have a kit, we'll have some with which to practice during the class and some others you can purchase so you can continue to practice after the class or at one of our many "Stitch & Bitch" gatherings throughout the week. Alternately, you can get your own yarn, hooks and/or a basic kit at the Walmart in Littleton, which is on the way to Roger's. If you're buying your own kit to bring, just: 1. Select a small skein of a light colored acrylic or cotton material (easier to see the stitches than with a dark color) in a worsted or sport weight (look on the label for the yarn weight). Number 4 is best. 2. Look at the yarn's label to see what size hook is recommended. You should see a picture of a hook with the size next to it. Bring that size hook or buy one if you don't have one already. 3. Ask an attendant at the store for help if you're not sure what to get. 4. Watch some beginner YouTube videos or buy a beginner "How to Crochet" book. It'll all make sense quicker if you've prepared before you come to PorcFest. 5. Show up to class on Tuesday with your kit and say Hi!!! Description: This is a beginner class where your fabulous instructor will teach you (or help you relearn) the basics. You will learn how to do a chain stitch and a "single crochet" stitch in this class. Master these stitches and you can start making crochet hats, scarves, blankets, and the like. See you there! Instructor: Kristin Alpert, Kristin learned to crochet when she was a pre-teen from her grandmother. She then let it slide while she attended Nursing school and started raising a family. In 2005, Kristin started crocheting again and found it was like riding a bike; everything came back to her! She finds it very relaxing and rewarding and especially enjoys making items which she gifts or donates to various causes. She hopes this class will spark interest and future learning for others.. Website When: Tue, 11:00A _(60m) Where: FIRE: 🔥The FireSteel.com Event Canopy🔥, RV13 Note: Join us for the "Daily Stitch & Bitch" from noon-2 all week (Monday to Saturday), and practice what you'll learn in this class! summary: How to Transcend Traps of the Mind Jonathan Mozenter [FIRE]
description:
For Whom: People motivated to move beyond patterns that are preventing them from manifesting the highest versions of themselves. 
Description: Jonathan has been a serious student of Tibetan Buddhism Dzogchen/Mahamudra lineages for more than 11 years that teach about awakening. This class will show why people are frequently stuck in sub-optimal patterns and how to choose more empowering ways of living. The class will be a mixture of presentation and experiential learning that will include pointing out new distinctions about how the mind and life works on deeper meta-physical levels and energy and meditation exercises. The goal is for every participant to leave with at least one insight they can use to improve the quality of their life on a daily basis. 
Speaker: Jonathan Mozenter, As a mentor, speaker, and consultant Jonathan Mozenter is deeply rooted in reverence for how everything in life serves our evolution. Individual and group transformation shines as his biggest passion. In addition to working twenty-five plus years in the field of Change Management and obtaining an MBA from Boston University, Jonathan has also studied with masters and gained experience in numerous esoteric areas including: EpiEnergetics, Tibetan Vajrayana Buddhism, Conscious Language, Shadow Work, Chi Energy Cultivation, Integral Theory, Human Design, and Gene Keys.

His unique blend of these lineages enables participants to be one with their heart and soul. As a spiritual stack-master, Jonathan helps clients weave meaning that both rewrites the past and curates the necessary energy shifts to be guided towards their brightest future. This guidance (known as Gnosis, Buddhahood, Christ Consciousness, or Soul Intelligence) is at the core of what Jonathan activates in those he serves. After witnessing the life-changing impact of this ability in his own life, Jonathan is committed to sharing this deeper connection to life with the world.
When: Sat, 7:00P _(60m)
Where: FIRE: 🔥The FireSteel.com Event Canopy🔥, RV13

For Whom: Anyone who is interested in a very basic and general discussion about body armor should attend. If you are curious, if you don’t own any body armor yet, or thinking about getting some, then join us. If you already have some gear, bring what you have and share what you’ve learned with the group. From soft armor to steel plates, from “outer” plate carriers to under the shirt/jacket-type concealable carriers, take a look, feel it, try it on if you like. But get yourself some armor for safety and protection if you don’t have some already. Good citizens should be able to carry and wear body armor wherever and whenever they see fit. 
Description: Let’s talk body armor. 
If you own firearms, then you should own safety gear as well. We’ll bring some of the gear we have, and show you what we’ve done with it; how we’ve set it ours up, how you can set yours up, and some of the differences between types of armor and types of plate carriers. 
Host: Mark Hansen, Mark is currently a special education teacher; former state parks ranger, and former hospital security officer. He is enthusiastic about firearms, liberty, freedom, safety, self defense (and motorcycles)! He is also proficient with pistol and rifle use.

summary: Detyranization: Making the state abolish itself Caleb James DeLisle [FIRE]
description: For Whom: People in, or interested in running for, local and state positions who want to have impact. Description: When: Saturday night, 10:00 PM Where: FireSteel Every few months there's a new oligarch law to further lord over the people, and many fight hard against them. But we are not effectively challenging the century or so of prior tyranny which has established itself as "normal". This talk is intended to help initiate and contribute to wider conversations around identifying local and state regulations which are not truly necessary. We will also briefly delve into ways that local and state authorities can be used as group-wise resistance against federal level tyranny. Speaker: Caleb James DeLisle, Open Source Developer, creator of cjdns encrypted mesh networking protocol, CryptPad collaborative editor, PacketCrypt bandwidth-hard proof-of-work & PKT blockchain. CTO: pktpal.com The free and open internet must be defended at all costs.. Website . Image When: Sat, 10:00P _(60m) Where: FIRE: 🔥The FireSteel.com Event Canopy🔥, RV13

For Whom: Hikers, nature lovers, outdoor enthusiasts, preparedness
Description: Join experienced NH hiker Derek Proulx as we look into the risks associated with hiking in the White Mountains and how to mitigate them.
Speaker: Derek Proulx, Derek Proulx is a NH native. Growing up in the Lakes Region of the state provided easy access to the wilderness of New Hampshire's White Mountains. He is a avid outdoorsman, experienced in backpacking, rock climbing, nordic skiing, snowboarding, snowshoeing, kayaking, and mountain biking. Derek is Wilderness First Aid certified, a veteran sergeant of the NH Army National Guard, and a three times finisher of the challenging NH 48 4000 Footer List. With many miles and days logged in the Whites, Derek has seen and heard it all.

When: Thu, 1:00P _(60m)
Where: FSBV: Free State Based Venue, RV60
Note: Among the most dangerous mountains in the world, Mount Washington has challenged adventurers for centuries with its severe weather. From the days when gentlefolk ascended the heights in hoop skirts and wool suits to today's high-tech assaults on wintry summits. 

The White Mountains of New Hampshire consist of a series of mountains whose maximum elevation reaches 6,288 feet (1,917 m) and represent some of the highest mountains in the United States east of the Mississippi River. Fatalities in this area are dominated by those that occur on Mount Washington, the highest peak in the range. It is notorious for its unpredictable and inclement weather, making it one of the deadliest mountains in the continental United States. Due to its unique location relative to other geographic features, it holds the world record for highest recorded surface wind speed not within a tropical cyclone. The New Hampshire Fish and Game Department conducts an average of 200 rescues a year for hikers in need of assistance. Mt. Washington has had more fatalities per vertical foot than any other mountain in the world.

We'll be taking a look at a few notable cases of disasterous climbs in the White Mountains, why these catastophes occur, details of the unique geography and weather, and steps YOU can take to make sure your hike doesn't end tragically.

For Whom: Hikers, nature lovers, outdoor enthusiasts
Description: Join experienced hiker, Derek Proulx, as he unpacks his bag and shows off the essential hiking gear he uses to camp and summit some of the most dangerous mountains in the world.
Speaker: Derek Proulx, Derek Proulx is a NH native. Growing up in the Lakes Region of the state provided easy access to the wilderness of New Hampshire's White Mountains. He is a avid outdoorsman, experienced in backpacking, rock climbing, nordic skiing, snowboarding, snowshoeing, kayaking, and mountain biking. Derek is Wilderness First Aid certified, a veteran sergeant of the NH Army National Guard, and a three times finisher of the challenging NH 48 4000 Footer List. With many miles and days logged in the Whites, Derek has seen and heard it all.

summary: Women Finding Support in the Free State Carol Pratt, Jess Pelletier [FSBV]
description:
For Whom: All women, particularly those who are considering the move to New Hampshire and wondering about community, support, children, love, family, etc.

Description: For many women, the idea of moving to a new state is daunting. The support from her long-time community of family and old friends can make her hesitate, no matter how much her (or her partner’s) libertarian worldview may clash with the politics currently surrounding her. Hear the experiences of a panel of women who made the move to New Hampshire as part of the Free State Project -- with or without a partner, and with or without children -- and share your own stories in small group discussions led by the panelists.

Time built in for socializing, refreshments and shopping the wares offered by based and beautiful Free State women following the program. 
Moderator: Carol Pratt, A recent retiree to New Hampshire, Carol considers herself a "LIVE FREE befORe you DIE" Free Stater. She lives in Dover NH with her husband, Dennis, and is active in many of the community-building projects he initiated, including The SHELL (a welcoming libertarian community center in the Seacoast region) and The Independence Inn (including its restaurant/bar, Heartwood), the premier liberty-oriented inn and public house in the world, located in Strafford NH.
Organizer: Jess Pelletier, 
When: Fri, 1:00P (120m)
Where: FSBV: Free State Based Venue, RV60

For Whom: People who like to quote constitutions Description: Because they assume powers that cannot be delegated, the federal and state constitutions are ultimately unsuitable as foundations for liberty. I will explain why basing arguments on them is not effective and is likely to be counterproductive. Speaker: Ian Underwood, Ian Underwood has been a planetary scientist and artificial intelligence researcher for NASA, the director of the renowned Ask Dr. Math service, co-founder of Bardo Farm and Shaolin Rifleworks, and a popular speaker at liberty-related events. He is the author of a series of Bare Minimum Books, which expose the simplicity underlying complex issues like law, education, and gun rights. He lives in Croydon, New Hampshire.. Website When: Wed, 5:00P _(60m) Where: FSBV: Free State Based Venue, RV60 More Info

summary: Secession debate: Axelman v. Villee!!! Alu Axelman, Stephen Villee [FSBV]
description: For Whom: Those interested in secession, debate, separation movements, and liberty! Description: Stephen Villee thinks that we should work to get the US government and NH to agree to part ways...Alu thinks NH should just secede! Who will make the better argument???? You decide!! Debater: Alu Axelman, Alu is the founder and editor-in-chief of LibertyBlock.com and President of the Foundation for NH Independence. He has been speaking and writing about peaceful separation since 2017, and he has written 8 books about liberty and secession. . Website Debater: Stephen Villee, Stephen Villee moved to New Hampshire from New York City in December 2003. He is a software engineer who enjoys hiking, yoga, and traveling to see solar eclipses. He previously served as treasurer of the New Hampshire Liberty Alliance, and currently serves as treasurer of the Free State Project. He produced a youtube video called “Proclivity for Taxing Income” about secession as a way to be free of federal income tax. When: Thu, 12:00P _(60m) Where: FSBV: Free State Based, RV60 More Info

summary: Stir the pot: Ideal Worship Music Varrin Swearingen [LE]
description: For Whom: Anyone interested in discussing thought provoking topics that combine Christianity and liberty. Description: Liberty Ecclesia hosts a daily lunch discussion series each year open to all with controversial topics relating to Christianity and (usually) liberty. The topic serves as a jumping-off point for meandering discussion over lunch (bring your own) that leaves every belly and mind refreshed! Today’s discussion: What sort of music is ideal for corporate worship in a church setting? How would we know if music is good or bad for worship? Moderator: Varrin Swearingen, Varrin is the Liberty Ecclesia Lead Organizer and moderates the annual Stir The Pot series. . Website When: Tue, 12:00P _(60m) Where: LE: Liberty Ecclesia, T2 More Info

description: For Whom: Anyone interested in discussing thought provoking topics that combine Christianity and liberty. For Whom: Friends, family, or acquaintances of FSP participants who have passed away within the last year, or anyone else interested in honoring them even if you didn't know them. 
Description: As the number of Free State Project participants has grown, so too have the number of those who have departed our midst. Each year we gather to honor the lives of those who are no longer with us by gathering for a time of remembrance. There will be no formal presentation, but friends and family of those who have passed on are welcome to share brief thoughts or stories about our loved ones. The 1:30-2:30 time in the Liberty Ecclesia tent overlaps other sessions to allow for people to come and go without missing an important session.
Host: Varrin Swearingen, Varrin is the Liberty Ecclesia Lead Organizer and has hosted several PorcFest memorial services.

summary: Libertarian Idiosyncrasies of Mormon Doctrine Michael South [LE]
description:
For Whom: Christian libertarians, Free Staters interested in another potential source of libertarians who already live in NH, and anyone interested in the interplay between religion and libertarianism should find this of interest. 
Description: Mormonism (the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints) is considered by Mormons to be a Christian religion. Part of what makes this statement questionable for many Christians is that Mormons have books in addition to the Bible that are considered by Mormons to be equally scriptural. This talk will focus on a set of teachings from these additional books (that is, doctrines unique to Mormonism) which are profoundly libertarian (way more libertarian, in fact, than the average Mormon!).  We'll go over these beliefs and some of their implications.
Speaker: Michael South, Michael is a direct descendant of the earliest Mormon leaders and an active member of the church. Having discovered libertarianism by accident, subsequent study of Mormon scripture has put him on a mission to convert all of his fellow Mormons to a belief in liberty that is fully grounded in their own religious belief system.
When: Wed, 3:00P _(60m)
Where: LE: Liberty Ecclesia, T2

summary: Freedom Haven project: How the Gospel can thrive Tony Olsen [LE]
description: For Whom: Christians who believe in the importance of socioeconomic freedom Description: A society based on force and compulsion negatively affects our spirituality, while a society based on freedom encourages and nourishes it. By 2037, the Freedom Haven project will liberate us from governmental captivity to make it easier for us to connect with God and eventually achieve our divine potential. Speaker: Tony Olsen, Tony Olsen is the chief architect of the Freedom Haven project and former missionary of the Gospel of Jesus Christ in former East Germany. He lived in West Germany a total of 4.5 years when he was a child, and then went on a mission to East Germany shortly after the wall came down. What he experienced there, and what he learned from the Gospel of Jesus Christ, opened his eyes to the importance of religious freedom and socioeconomic freedom in general.. Website When: Thu, 3:00P _(60m) Where: LE: Liberty Ecclesia, T2 More Info

summary: Government Obedience, Key Bible Passages Varrin Swearingen [LE]
description: For Whom: Anyone, Christian or otherwise, interested in detailed insights into the Bible passages most often used to advocate unqualified Christian obedience to government. Note: although we may be able to survey these passages in 60 minutes, discussion usually runs long for this topic. Therefore, we have 90 minutes of time blocked out to allow for sufficient Q&A. Description: Does the Bible really require Christians to obey government without question? Did Jesus say taxes were good? We will review portions of Romans 13, 1 Peter 2, and Matthew 22, which are often used to extol the goodness of government and taxation. Speaker: Varrin Swearingen, Varrin is the Liberty Ecclesia Lead Organizer.. Website When: Wed, 3:00P _(90m) Where: LE: Liberty Ecclesia, T2 More Info

For Whom: Those who wish to travel armed between US states Description: A discussion on driving and flying in these united states with a gun, reducing the risks of violating the wide variety of anti-gun rules of state and federal governments. The event focuses on handguns carried for personal protection, held at the quiet Rebel Civics hub at the top of the hill under the trees. This will be a small event with plenty of Q&A and discussion time. Speaker: Keith Bessette, Keith has traveled by car to PorcFest three times from South Florida while armed, camping on the way up and back, and spent months traveling and living in the camper with a handgun. He has flown to Montana, Philadelphia, Portland ME, and Burlington VT from Florida with a checked handgun. So far Keith as been to 17 states with a handgun. His girlfriend is weary of The Talk on crossing each state line about yet another set of gun rules. Crossing a line can go from being allowed to carry in a grocery store, to the firearm must be unloaded and locked in the safe with the ammo in a separate hard-sided locked container. Some states we can legally open carry in the national forest campgrounds and in some states we are not allowed to camp in the forest at all because we have a gun. This takes research and should not be taken lightly, as jail is a distinct possibility in the communist US states. Keith has a Florida CWL, an NRA Range Safety Officer (RSO) certification, and passed the classroom training, test, and range qual for the Florida Class D Security Officer and Class G Armed Security licenses. Professionally, Keith is an electrical and systems engineer with 30 years experience designing communications systems for military aircraft, ships, and submarines. Keith hosts the Rebel Civics show on Unsafe Space, writes for UncoverDC and Liberty Block, and is Admin of the FLexit Facebook group.. Website . Image When: Tue, 1:00P _(60m) Where: REBL: Rebel Civics - Unsafe Space, T50 Note: Traveling these united states with a firearm for personal protection requires managing the risk of governments who gleefully infringe on your natural right to keep and bear arms. Rules vary enormously state by state. It is prudent to research and follow requirements for each state one is traveling through and stopping in. Selection of firearms, accessories, and ammunition is critical. Transport locations and locking equipment matter. More Info

summary: Strength Training- The Squat, Bench, and Deadlift Micah Deshaies [GYM]
description: For Whom: Folks new or interested in strength training with barbells Description: This one is interactive! We will teach you how to safely squat, bench, and deadlift. As we are teaching each lift we will talk about basic programming of exercises. Many people "exercise", they get sweaty and sore but they don't "train". Training is when you have a goal in mind and a specific plan to get there. For beginners we have found that a basic method called Starting Strength by Mark Rippetoe is a great place to get started. At the end of this mini seminar you will have a basic lifting program and a coach will teach you proper form on the squat, bench, and deadlift No experience necessary. Wear stretchy pants or shorts. Location RV129 or the overflow parking area next to RV129 Organizer: Micah Deshaies, Owner of Free State Barbell Club in Manchester, NH. I am passionate about working with people who are new to lifting weights. "Strong people are harder to kill than weak people, and more useful in general" - Mark Rippetoe. Website When: Fri, 8:00A _(90m) Where: GYM: Free State Barbell Club of the North, RV129 Note: Free State Barbell Club is a 24/7/365 key club gym located on the West Side of Manchester, NH. Check out or website fsbb.club or email at info@fsbb.club! More Info

For Whom: Anyone with a really strong belief about some aspect of liberty in the world, which they can passionately express in three minutes, and which they would like to share with the entire festival in our concluding event on Saturday.
Description: The SoapBox Idol competition is the penultimate event of PorcFest. It ends our formal program on Saturday afternoon. And it's your opportunity to share your three minute rant for freedom and against tyranny. But so great is the desire of our Porcupines and Porcupine-wannabes to cry out for freedom, that we hold auditions at which you practice your rant with Queen Quill. The Queen is looking for an assortment of rant topics and of ranting Porcupines to entertain and inspire us on Saturday, and she offers helpful advice. So, come share your piss and vinegar.
Queen Quill: Carla Gericke, Carla designed, and has been organizing and moderating, the SoapBox Idol since its inception. A passionate speaker herself, who has wowed audiences and media with her rants for freedom, she seeks to give you a platform to let your inner freedom spirit cry out!
When: Wed, 10:00A _(60m)
Where: QQC: Queen Quill's Court, Green Cabin
Note: Rants will be held Wed, Thur, Fri, and Sat at 10A at the Queen Quill tent. You MUST audition if you would like to rant on the soapbox Saturday night. Preference given to those who audition early!

summary: Cigars & Tobacco Meetup Sarah Faber, Dominic DeMaria [SLL]
description: For Whom: People who love - or curious about, smoking cigars. Description: Join us at the Seacoast Liberty Lounge on Friday, from 6-8pm! The first 15 people to show up, get a FREE cigar! For Whom: Anyone with any questions for a libertarian MD
Description: Medical questions
Medical concerns
Thoughts that the medical industrial complex might not have your best interest in mind? 
 "Ask the Doctor " continues the annual  tradition where you can ask Dr. Jim Laurenzano what is on your mind in an open small group setting. Dr. Laurenzano has been practicing clinical medicine for 40+ years and enjoys discussing the issues of the day from a libertarian perspective of shared decision making.
 
There is no need to prepare anything in advance-Just join in the discussion.

If  you do not have anything prepared, Dr. Laurenzano will have something to lead off the discussion. 

: 
When: Wed, 9:00A _(90m)
Where: NCP: North Country Porcupine Lounge, RV115

summary: How to Write and Publish a Book w/ Scott Horton Scott Horton [TLI]
description: For Whom: Potential authors. Description: Come by the Libertarian Institute hub, grab a beer, and listen to Scott Horton tell you everything he's learned about how to write and publish a book. : Scott Horton, Scott Horton is director of the Libertarian Institute, editorial director of Antiwar.com, host of Antiwar Radio on Pacifica, 90.7 FM KPFK in Los Angeles, California and podcasts the Scott Horton Show from ScottHorton.org. He's the author of the 2021 book Enough Already: Time to End the War on Terrorism, the 2017 book, Fool's Errand:Time to End the War in Afghanistan, editor of the 2019 book The Great Ron Paul: The Scott Horton Show Interviews 2004–2019 and the 2022 book Hotter Than The Sun: Time to Abolish Nuclear Weapons. He’s conducted more than 5,800 interviews since 2003.. Website When: Thu, 5:00P _(60m) Where: TLI: The Libertarian Institute, RV37 More Info

summary: Queer (gay / LGBT+) Mixer: Solstice Edition Greg M., Jeff Y. [BFV]
description: For Whom: Description: Come meet and mingle with other queer porcupines at the friendliest camp of them all, Body Freedom Village! You can dance if you want to, or you can stargaze from the hot tub under the solstice moon. Celestial outfits encouraged! BFV has space for tents and vendors for those that are a good fit! Find the contact info at the website. Camp is clothing optional. Self expression is encouraged and all body types are welcome. This event is 18+, as is BFV after sunset. Organizer: Greg M.. Website : Jeff Y., Jeff is the host of BFV. He's an ancap that signed the pledge in 2016 and moved from San Francisco in 2021. He hopes to bring freedoms to NH to help make it the freest place in the world, not just the the freest place in the region! When: Wed, 9:00P _(90m) Where: BFV: Body Freedom Village, RV210 More Info

description: For Whom: Friendly, open-minded singles and electron-deficient polycules. (The "+" is for couples wanting a polycule, etc.) If there's just a few people, we'll lounge, hang out, and play some games. If there's a bunch of people, then get ready to dance! With any luck, hot tub will be ready to go! BFV has space for tents and vendors for those that are a good fit! Find the contact info at the website. Camp is clothing optional. summary: Radical Expression Dance Party: Blacklight Jungle Jeff Y. [BFV]
description: For Whom: Friendly, open-minded porcupines! Camp is clothing optional. Self expression is encouraged and all body types are welcome. This event is 18+, as is BFV after sunset. Description: It's the last night of PorcFest, and your last chance to celebrate freedom until 2024! We'd love to see you in your favorite Victorian cage crinoline, your pirate costume, your fairy wings, your neon body paint, or your birthday suit! This year, the dance floor will be adorned with blacklights and jungle decorations. If you want to be camouflaged, consider dressing up as a safari hunter, or getting body painted as a jungle animal! Professional body painter onsite! Come dance at the friendliest camp at PorcFest, or warm up in the hot tub (assuming it hasn't popped yet!). Either way, have fun and omg please help us consume our remaining snacks and bevys! Organizer: Jeff Y., Jeff is the host of BFV. He's an ancap that signed the pledge in 2016 and moved from San Francisco in 2021. He hopes to bring freedoms to NH to help make it the freest place in the world, not just the the freest place in the region!. Website When: Sat, 10:30P (120m) Where: BFV: Body Freedom Village, RV210 More Info

summary: Mindfulness Meditation for All w/ Mike R. Michael R. [BFV]
description: For Whom: ξενία: All who come in peace are welcome here This is a family-friendly event in a clothing-optional village. Kids must be accompanied by parent. Feel free to reach out for any reason to Mike at 6039320243, especially if this will be your first mindfulness meditation for preemptive encouragement. Description: Join us as we reconnect with the ever present simplicity of being. Non-judgmental present moment awareness. All experience levels will be embraced as Mike R. invites you to join him on a spontaneous journey into the interior. Michael Rohan is a meditation practitioner of, woah, eight years already. He has Shambhala level one, and has sought guidance and inspiration from Jon Kabat-Zinn, John Vervaeke, as well as others. Consider taking advantage of the meditation location, BFV, as you will be free to dress according to your comfort and preference. Facilitator: Michael R., Michael Rohan is a meditation practitioner of, woah, eight years already. He has Shambhala level one, and has sought guidance and inspiration from Jon Kabat-Zinn, John Vervaeke, as well as others. When: Thu, 9:00A _(60m) Where: BFV: Body Freedom Village, RV210 Note: Please bring your own meditation cushion, blanket, pillow, chair or whatever you'd like to sit comfortably. If arriving late or leaving early, please simply be courteous of other mediators. More Info

For Whom: Alt lifestyle is for the queer, the kinksters, the outliers, the seekers of experience
Description: We are back again for PFXX! Alt-Lifestyles presents the freest munch on the planet. Come one and all! Interested in moving to NH but concerned you won't find like-minded people in leather or latex? We are here, and come from a vibrant and growing scene. Living in NH already but missing that spark of S&M? Meet your fellow explorers in outer experiences and see where we have been hiding. While here, thank our fabulous hosts at BFV and experience the finest hot tub at PorcFest.
Organizer: Chris
When: Fri, 7:00P _(90m)
Where: BFV: Body Freedom Village, RV210

For Whom: This is a clothing-optional camp. All friendly bodies are welcome; kids must be accompanied by a parent. Parental discretion is advised. Trigger warning: guns, nudity, and adult humor. Description: “I haven’t put much thought into my attire + gun + holster,” said no libertarian ever. Do you have so much camo that you need to strut down a runway for anyone to notice you? Want to show off how you can carry a BFG while wearing 6 inch heels? Want to show the best solution you found for a nudist to carry? Perhaps you fashion yourself a cowboy? Then come on down to Body Freedom Village to showcase your (bits and) pieces! For those that want to express or exaggerate their feminine side, wigs and makeup will be available. Organizer: Jeff Y., Jeff is the host of BFV. He's an ancap that signed the pledge in 2016 and moved from San Francisco in 2021. He hopes to bring freedoms to NH to help make it the freest place in the world, not just the the freest place in the region! When: Thu, 3:00P _(90m) Where: BFV: Body Freedom Village, RV210 Note: Please arrive early if you want to walk the runway. We'll probably start late! Toy and water guns are acceptable. Immaculate gun safety handling required. More Info

This is a family-friendly event in a clothing-optional village. Description: Does your paleo diet make you an ideal human specimen? Last year, Goldbacks also sponsored real gold and silver prizes! Events include things like throwing a shot put (medicine ball). Organizer: Jeff Y., Jeff is the host of BFV. He's an ancap that signed the pledge in 2016 and moved from San Francisco in 2021. He hopes to bring freedoms to NH to help make it the freest place in the world, not just the the freest place in the region! summary: Live Free and Hike Derek Proulx, Reed Coverdale [FSBL]
description: For Whom: Hikers Description: Hiking in the White Mountains - Caps Ridge Trail to Mt Jefferson Summit. Difficulty: HARD Leader: Derek Proulx, Derek Proulx, Derek Proulx is a NH native. Growing up in the Lakes Region of the state provided easy access to the wilderness of New Hampshire's White Mountains. He is a avid outdoorsman, experienced in backpacking, rock climbing, nordic skiing, snowboarding, snowshoeing, kayaking, and mountain biking. Derek is Wilderness First Aid certified, a veteran sergeant of the NH Army National Guard, and a three times finisher of the challenging NH 48 4000 Footer List. With many miles and days logged in the Whites, Derek has seen and heard it all. Leader: Reed Coverdale, Host of the Naturalist Capitalist. Hiker. Truck Driver. Free Stater. Free Thinker. When: Mon, 7:00A (360m) Where: FSBL: Free State Based Lounge, RV59 Note: We will be meeting at the Free State Based(FSBL) tentsite area(59/60) at 7AM sharp. This a first come first serve trip. First 6 to show up get to come on the hike. We have 2 vehicles that Derek Proulx and Reed Coverdale will drive for transportation to and from the trailhead. Trailheads are approximately 35 minutes from Rogers. Time to return is approximately 1PM. Caps Ridge Trail is a 4.3-mile out-and-back trail near Mount Washington to the summit of Mt Jefferson. Generally considered a challenging route, it takes an average of 4 h 5 min to complete. Nicknamed the "Fastest Route to the Jet Stream" this trail is steep and rocky. Please come prepared with your own backpack, food, water, and proper hiking attire/footware. Anyone ill prepared or of inadequate fitness will not be allowed to hike with this group. More Info

summary: Live Free and Hike Derek Proulx, Reed Coverdale [FSBL]
description: For Whom: Hikers Description: Hiking in the White Mountains - Artist Bluff. Difficulty: EASY Leader: Derek Proulx, Derek Proulx, Derek Proulx is a NH native. Growing up in the Lakes Region of the state provided easy access to the wilderness of New Hampshire's White Mountains. He is a avid outdoorsman, experienced in backpacking, rock climbing, nordic skiing, snowboarding, snowshoeing, kayaking, and mountain biking. Derek is Wilderness First Aid certified, a veteran sergeant of the NH Army National Guard, and a three times finisher of the challenging NH 48 4000 Footer List. With many miles and days logged in the Whites, Derek has seen and heard it all. Leader: Reed Coverdale, Host of the Naturalist Capitalist. Hiker. Truck Driver. Free Stater. Free Thinker. When: Wed, 7:00A (180m) Where: FSBL: Free State Based Lounge, RV59 Note: We will be meeting at the Free State Based(FSBL) tentsite area(59/60) at 7AM sharp. This a first come first serve trip. First 6 to show up get to come on the hike. We have 2 vehicles that Derek Proulx and Reed Coverdale will drive for transportation to and from the trailhead. Trailheads are approximately 35 minutes from Rogers. Time to return is approximately 10AM. Artist Bluff is a 1.5-mile loop trail near Franconia, New Hampshire. It takes an average of 53 min to complete. This is arguably the best views for the easiness of the hike in the whole state. Please come prepared with your own water and proper hiking attire/footware. Anyone ill prepared or of inadequate fitness will not be allowed to hike with this group. More Info

summary: Live Free and Hike Derek Proulx, Reed Coverdale [FSBL]
description: For Whom: Hikers Description: Hiking in the White Mountains - Mt Willard. Difficulty: MODERATE Leader: Derek Proulx, Derek Proulx, Derek Proulx is a NH native. Growing up in the Lakes Region of the state provided easy access to the wilderness of New Hampshire's White Mountains. He is a avid outdoorsman, experienced in backpacking, rock climbing, nordic skiing, snowboarding, snowshoeing, kayaking, and mountain biking. Derek is Wilderness First Aid certified, a veteran sergeant of the NH Army National Guard, and a three times finisher of the challenging NH 48 4000 Footer List. With many miles and days logged in the Whites, Derek has seen and heard it all. Leader: Reed Coverdale, Host of the Naturalist Capitalist. Hiker. Truck Driver. Free Stater. Free Thinker. It takes an average of 1 h 50 min to complete. The summit provides excellent views of the stunning Crawford Notch and Southern Presidential Range. Please come prepared with your own backpack, food, water, and proper hiking attire/footware. Anyone ill prepared or of inadequate fitness will not be allowed to hike with this group. More Info

summary: How to build a ghost gun (Glock handguns) Andrew Noveske [420]
description:
For Whom: Anyone wanting to learn how to build an unserialized, unregistered, and unknown firearm. number comeandbuildit
Description: So you wanna build a ghost gun? Bring all the necessary parts to this free workshop and you will take home your very own ghosty.

Workshop will be hosted by Andrew Noveske at Somali Stash House/Vice City, site RV173, 420 on the map, on Thursday June 22nd at 6pm
Host: Andrew Noveske, This will be Andrews third year doing gun builder workshops at Porcfest. Entertaining and informative with a vast knowledge of firearms.
When: Thu, 5:00P _(90m)
Where: 420: Somali Stash House presents: Vice City, R173
Note: Parts needed-
Polymer80 or competitor 80% Glock style frame
Lower parts kit
Barrel
Upper parts kit
Slide to match the frame

Tools will be available, but feel free to bring your own drill/dremel.

For Whom: Homeschooling parents and possibly kiddos if deemed appropriate by parent
Description: Buy expensive prefab curriculum books that aim to teach your child "everything"? NO. Outsource your child's brain to someone else? NO. Attend public school?? HELL NO! Let's get a round table going and explore the unorthodox methods, curricula, and techniques used in your house to make your specific homeschooling experience uniquely engaging for your kids! Let's pool our creative energies and share some of the clever tricks that produced big results in your family!
Host: Daniel Shortell, Agorist, Homeschooling Parent, Multiple business-owning Freedom Lover and Event-hosting Extraordinaire 
When: Wed, 3:00P _(60m)
Where: CHAP: Chapatis – Malaysian Indian Cuisine, RV65

For Whom: Conspiracy theorists who love pulling people down into their esoteric rabbit holes in search of truthy nuggets of deliciousness. Reality is the perception you create for yourself and others, everything else is a propagandist's sales pitch.

The host, Chapatis, will be offering discounted caffeine injections (by way of chai service) to ensure wide-eyed, mouth-foaming conspiracy loonies are living up to all the trite characterizations lobbed at them by the civilized normie-clique.
Description: You know you're a science-denying, fact-hating, shadow-banned, knuckle-dragging ape-of-a-subhuman piece-of-garbage that lurches from one fantastical lie to another like some sort of idiot-savant in search of the holy grail of lunacy....right? Or, perhaps you just don't trust authority and have a rational opinion that deviates from the given narrative. summary: The Pocket Guide To KILLING Gun Control! Alu Axelman [Alu]
description: For Whom: Anyone who believes in gun rights, self-defense, property rights, or liberty - or if you love gun control and are open to being talked out of it ;) Description: Do you hate guns? Are you afraid of them? Do you think that only government employees should be trusted to own such dangerous weapons? Do you think that we need laws to prohibit crazy or violent people from using guns to hurt others? Or are you looking for the best arguments to use with your anti-gun relatives, friends, and colleagues? In just a few minutes, this book will arm you with everything you need! Speaker: Alu Axelman, Elliot “Alu” Axelman lives in southern New Hampshire with his wife and son. Since creating The Liberty Block in 2017 as an extension of his radio show, the site has grown to become one of the preeminent pro-freedom & pro-independence publications in the world. Alu identifies as a voluntaryist and is very passionate about a multitude of liberty issues, including gun rights, taxation, education freedom, property rights, free speech, due process, and health freedom. Over the past few years, Alu has discovered that nearly every road to liberty leads to secession, so he has dedicated himself primarily to peaceful separation from the tyrants in DC. He currently serves as President of The Foundation for New Hampshire Independence and director & editor-in-chief of The Liberty Block. This is Alu’s ninth book. . Website When: Fri, 4:00P _(30m) Where: Alu: Alu's Amazing Books & The Liberty Block!, RV1 Note: This is my NEWEST BOOK pretty much being published and offered AT PORCFEST 2023!!!!! More Info

Keith knows he might lose, as evidence shows it hasn't worked, but argues the document interpreted as the Founders wrote and intended it is pretty good on liberty. Debater: Alu Axelman, Alu's most recent book claims that the US Constitution is terrible for liberty. Alu has sold over 1,000 books and is a frequent speaker at Porcfest. He is the founder of The Liberty Block and current President of the Foundation for New Hampshire Independence.. For Whom: Parents/guardians of children age approx 5 to 16 Description: Join Michelle Levell, director of Granite State Home Educators (GSHE), for an open chat on all things about education freedom in NH. GSHE has extensive resources to help you maximize the freedom and flexibility of home education while minimizing government interference. We have tips to keep costs down and help you find your "tribe" and make new friends. Join Michelle on Friday 6/23 at noon and again on Saturday 6/24 at 1pm. Stop by her hub at RV site 118 Thursday through Sunday anytime you want to talk more. Facilitator: Michelle Levell, Michelle Levell has been active in state-level education issues and policy for nearly 20 years. She is the director and co-founder of Granite State Home Educators, an all-volunteer 501c4, statewide support organization with over 15,000 members. The GSHE website is widely considered the most extensive resource for New Hampshire homeschoolers with over 700 articles and nearly 50 pages. GSHE also manages seven different social media groups to support our community. Michelle has extensive experience as a volunteer-advocate working with legislators, national organizations, and grassroots activists on a wide range of education issues. She served as a full-time volunteer for the largest scholarship organization in the state for five years, helped launch a chartered public school, served on the board of a nonpublic school, and served on additional boards of directors for other NH-based nonprofits. She has first-hand experience with home education, online learning, gifted and 2e education, as well as private education. Her three children are now college graduates and employed in their chosen careers -- a public-school math teacher, a PhD candidate and research assistant in computational material science engineering, and another as a civil engineer.. Website When: Fri, 12:00P _(60m) Where: Hive: Anie's Hive, Bingo More Info

summary: Acupuncture: What's the point? Carla San Diego [ACU]
description: For Whom: If you've been curious about Acupuncture and would like to know more! Description: Stop by for a Meet & Greet at Porcupuncture (T20/ACU) Thursday 6/22 & Friday 6/23 after yoga. Acupuncturist Carla San Diego will be set up both days from 12:30-5:30pm for inquiries, consults and semi-private acupuncture sessions. Appointments available but not necessary. Host: Carla San Diego, I started my career path with 15 years in the NYC fashion industry until the stress led to health issues that drove me to seek help beyond conventional medicine. That’s when I discovered Acupuncture and began to appreciate Chinese Medicine's holistic view of health and healing. Four years of graduate school later, I earned a Master of Science to become licensed, board-certified and practicing acupuncture and herbal medicine for the past decade. My approach combines Traditional Chinese Medicine, modern orthopedics and clinical nutrition to balance the body's energy, anatomy and chemistry as one. This is my first year in NH and at Porcfest so I’m excited to share my practice with other Porcs, learn new stuff and hopefully help a few people feel better.. Website When: Thu, 12:30P (300m) Where: ACU: Porcupuncture, T20 Note: Balance never hurts anyone. More Info

summary: Go on the Offensive Against Big Government Carla Howell [LP]
description:
For Whom: People who want to turn today’s political commentary on its head by going beyond merely playing defense against big government to moving our communities, our nation, and our world in the direction of small government. This is especially important for candidates, podcasters, and others who speak publicly. It's useful for any supporter of liberty.

Description: 
Speaker: Carla Howell, Carla Howell is a long-time small-government activist. She ran for office on the Libertarian ticket three times in Massachusetts, winning the endorsement of the Boston Herald in her race for state auditor (1998). She won 12% of the vote for U.S. Senate against Ted Kennedy (2000), almost beating the Republican.

In 2002, she ran for governor against Mitt Romney while championing her first statewide ballot initiative to end the income tax, which won 45% of the vote. She ran another initiative to end the income tax in 2008 and one to cut the state sales tax in 2010, which won almost one million votes.

In 2012, Carla Howell moved to Virginia where she served as Executive and Political Director for the Libertarian National Committee (2011-2017). She has coached hundreds of candidates and spokespersons for local, state, and federal campaigns across the country. She co-founded the Center For Small Government in 2005 and also composes libertarian songs which she has recorded and released.
When: Thu, 1:00P _(60m)
Where: LP: Libertarian Party, RV50

summary: Go on the Offensive Against Big Government Carla Howell [LP]
description:
For Whom: People who want to turn today’s political commentary on its head by going beyond merely playing defense against big government to moving our communities, our nation, and our world in the direction of small government. This is especially important for candidates, podcasters, and others who speak publicly. It's useful for any supporter of liberty.
Description: 
Speaker: Carla Howell,  Carla Howell is a long-time small-government activist. She ran for office on the Libertarian ticket three times in Massachusetts, winning the endorsement of the Boston Herald in her race for state auditor (1998). She won 12% of the vote for U.S. Senate against Ted Kennedy (2000), almost beating the Republican.

In 2002, she ran for governor against Mitt Romney while championing her first statewide ballot initiative to end the income tax, which won 45% of the vote. She ran another initiative to end the income tax in 2008 and one to cut the state sales tax in 2010, which won almost one million votes.

In 2012, Carla Howell moved to Virginia where she served as Executive and Political Director for the Libertarian National Committee (2011-2017). She has coached hundreds of candidates and spokespersons for local, state, and federal campaigns across the country. She co-founded the Center For Small Government in 2005 and also composes libertarian songs which she has recorded and released.
When: Fri, 11:00A _(60m)
Where: LP: Libertarian Party, RV50
Note: Almost everywhere that you hear or see libertarian commentary (campaigns, speeches, think tanks, podcasts, TV, radio, etc.) it’s about what’s wrong with government.

Or it’s an attempt to stave off the latest proposal for more government.

In short, liberty advocates are playing defense. 

When all we do is play defense, the best possible outcome is we keep government big. The worst outcome is that government gets even bigger. More war. Fewer rights. More human suffering.

This is a losing strategy.

But when we go on the offensive, the worst possible outcome is we keep government big. The best outcome is that we actually move in the direction of small government. More freedom. More peace. People thrive.

In this session, you’ll learn how to be a champion for small government, with time for Q&A and some mock interviews.

For Whom: New to homeschool/unschool parents (or grandparents) or parents pulling their teens out for the first time. Description: There are a lot of people interested in child-led (unschooling) learning but it can feel really overwhelming and hard to get past your own programming if you went to public school. We all want what's best for our kids and it gets really hard when we worry about doing it wrong or failing them. I was never at any school before I turned 18 and I've been in business for myself ever sense, I'm 41 now with a 7 year old son. This won't be too formal, just come ask me anything, I'm happy to help in any way I can. Host: Moira Mills, Born to an English mother and a father who grew up as an American farm kid, Moira spent her childhood being unschooled (by Libertarian parents) on a farm in rural Alaska. This unorthodox upbringing has given Moira a unique appreciation for exploration and self-discovery that shapes her philosophy of childhood and how kids learn, and the important role of imagination and creativity. Moira’s decision to become a mother was a pivotal moment in her life and, because of this, in the spring of 2016 she began to develop the concept for a new business model. By the following year, as a local initiative of her online platform, Moira started “Albany Pop-Up Adventure Playground,” a temporary play space filled with loose parts and objects designed to inspire imagination and creativity. By the time of the plandemic, more than 700 people have attended the pop-ups, which Moira designed as an opportunity for all children to have access to child-led play in her own local community. In 2023 Moira and her son London moved to Chester, Vermont where a new chapter is now unfolding. When: Wed, 8:00A _(60m) Where: RV30: RV30, RV30 More Info
